_Ld5hESNvNtzXP7jKozOzg.text: The food here is excellent. As a huge fan of a good steak, but also a fan of tofu, I feel highly qualified to review this restaurant. While you wait by the bar, they have a selection of interesting juices to choose from. And I learned a new fact - you can't drink straight beet juice because it won't agree with your insides. Who knew? Glad they had the facts.I really enjoyed my sweet potato and cashew curry. Yum, yum. Very filling and comfort-food-esque. I also enjoyed their big chocolately dessert. Gluten-free notes: This place goes out of their way to help non-vegetarian people with food restrictions. They identify wheat-free and gluten-free items on the menu, and there's plenty for you to choose from.

zI3LcEKd1bnN1qwxrj21_Q.text: I've had some varying experiences here. I've been eating vegetarian food for decades, and been veggie myself for over 10 years, now, so Mildred's really ought to do it for me. Maybe I have been unlucky, but what I've ordered has never quite lived up to expectations: perfectly edible, but nothing more exciting than I could have made myself at home. (And I don't regard myself as an exceptional cook). But the main downer - as others have mentioned - is the service. It has varied from quite good to the downright awful. There is simply no excuse for waitresses being uppity with customers. It feels like they are so successful, they don't have to try too hard, which is a real pity.

-x9cvLUiOWBSWJEjgHYK6Q.text: After eating out at a few vegetarian, vegan, and raw places when I was in New York, I developed an appreciation for good, vegetarian food. Which is exactly what Mildred's does.Tasty, inventive vegetarian dishes at what for London is a very reasonable price point - you can get out of there for less than £15 if you skip the drinks and dessert.Only downside is that everyone else in London knows how good it is, too. When I went (at 6:30pm on a Thursday night) there was a 40 minute wait for a table.Highly recommended nonetheless.

YRjXuhlshBzp-G6wHitn_Q.text: I was expecting a lot walking into Mildreds. I ended up ordering a burger, guacamole and the sweet potato fries. The beetroot burger was exceptional, especially the sauce, the guacamole had too much onion and was not freshly made, quite cold and obviously refrigerated, not the Mexican way. Its not difficult to mash some avocados to order and the dish ends up so much better. The sweet potato fries were also mildly warm and not crispy, again indicating that they had been sitting around for a while. I'll give Mildreds another go, but the first visit was not impressive compared to many vegan restaurants I have become acquainted with.

cBw4BrMBcTHi0nMdiY4Fog.text: Went here with a friend for dinner. We both had the organic detox salad, one with tofu and one with goat cheese. We were both really impressed and the salad was so fresh. Yummy vinaigrette. The place was really loud and the service wasn't the quickest, but I'd definitely go again. Great vegetarian, vegan and gluten free options.

VdAT57-RkPR_hL1R4WFt0Q.text: Yummmmmm :)Highly rated from a non-vege. On a Saturday evening around 7 we came and was luckily seated within 30-40 minutes. The place was very very popular.The food was delicious. Lots of varieties from sweet potato and cashew nut curry to aubergine chickpeas tagine with couscous and harissa sauce, to an awesome towering burger and stir fry asian vegetables. Sweet potato chips? Mmm :) Definitely an interesting menu .. short and sweet.Desserts did not disappoint as well. We settled on tofu cheesecake (vegan) and pistachio and white chocolate cheesecake. Recommend the tofu cheesecake.

5mbWpzTqZRgYTgakIlyLOg.text: Casual vegetarian dining. Crowded and quirky structure (up and down stairs). Food excellent - great veggieburgers, and good selection of other things.

1HtEaBMSqj2pisbn9GK5vA.text: Stopped by for a late lunch - had the dumplings, samosas, and burger - all three were reasonably priced and just fantastic tasting!  What a bright spot for a vegan in London!  Will return for sure.

KvzUL2PSbiWcaUIXgOX0Cw.text: Awesome restaurant!  Was in town with the family and went there on New Year's eve.   Tastey vegetarian comfort food.  Mostly vegan with a touch of dairy.  We enjoyed it.  The Poland beet-veggie burger was awesome - crispy with fresh ingredients. Samosas were yummy as well. Recommend the pudding for dessert.

ps_qMqYdtk1CbIKBwezFxA.text: Tasty. I read about this place on Yelp and added it to my bookmarks, and then i heard Jason Schwartzman saying in an interview that he loves Mildreds and has to stop by whenever he's in London to have their sweet potato wedges! So i made it my mission!I liked it. I really did.Ordered some of the sweet potato wedges as a side (amazing), and for main got "sunblushed tomato and buffalo mozzarella risotto cake served with wilted spinach, green beans and grape mustard cream sauce". Delicious!It seems like it is always manic in there. We got there at 6pm and it was nearly full. I thought the twelve and a half percent service was cheeky, but i what can you do?Thanks Mildred!

photos.caption: Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom. sunblushed tomato and buffalo mozzarella risotto cake & sweet potato wedges.

9O-F8DV4S-wDmWHK1gf3Cw.text: Such a fabulous restaurant. Always heaving which is indicative of how well thought of it is. Some of the best vegetarian cuisine I've ever had the pleasure to enjoy. Prices are a little on the steep side hence the lack of 5 star rating. I'll certainly be returning but at an off peak time!

ud9cvTGZaWmz9VbyP7U38g.text: Nice food, vegi and some vegan + gluten free, slow and unattendive service makes this vegi jewel just "ok"

1EDanUHqvLOTzuJwDTU0zQ.text: This was such a fun treat! I didn't know where to grab a quick bite to eat but my friend had just the spot for us. Vegetarian was the theme but you wouldn't have known there wasn't any meat on the menu with how great the menu was! We sat outside and I actually didn't make it inside at all. Outside was cute and the service was excellent. I ordered the detox salad and beet juice :) Happy happy. I heard they do great dinners, and I will be sure to stop by here again when I'm back in town!

c784eVyzk7lZLmffaHNgzw.text: The food here was lovely. The service left a lot to be desired.We tried quite a few dishes and each one was a delight. The space is quite small and the place smelled of the cigarettes from outside ( not the restaurants fault, but still very annoying).If you want a vegetarian meal then Mildreds is a good bet.They also have gluten free and vegan options.

9FyqGr1hqmPUrBuiIPul1w.text: When you've had a long morning of shopping with the crowds on Oxford street, your feet are aching, your shopping bags are weighing you down and your purse is feeling considerably lighter, there's nothing like a pick-me-up Mildred's lunch to get you back on track!My sister first introduced me to this place as she used to go there with her work friends and it has literally revolutionised my shopping life.  I now look forward to lunch more than my purchases!  This great vegetarian place always has friendly staff and amazing food, although they don't always have a table so it is best to go for lunch either early or late to avoid disappointment.  The sweet potato and cashew nut curry is to die for, especially when washed down with their delicious wild elderflower bubbly! It often leaves me too full for a proper dinner so definitely worth the pennies!  All in all, Mildred's is definitely worth a visit - even if you're a meat lover, the food is substantial enough to fulfill any appetite!

xj75kiVjSK7jqiB4yEm67Q.text: Having a wheat intolerance, this restaurant is a safe heaven for myself, offering more than a handful of (vegetarian) dishes which are wheat free, gluten free or in some cases both - that also includes starters and dessert !It is one of my favourite haunts when I am in London so I do try and go every time I'm there and it is pretty much guaranteed that the place is busy no matter what time of the day. So seeing as they don't take reservations, be prepared to wait for a while - though it is definitely worth it.The quality of food is good. While not excellent, the general price of the menu balances it out bumping my rating from 3 stars to 4 stars.My favourite dish is the creamy sweet potato and plum tomato curry with pea basmati and lime pickle, but be wary of the lime pickle as it can be very sour to those unsuspecting taste buds. The dessert menu is equally as good as the main, which makes it good for those sweet toothed out there. My personal recommendation is the vanilla rice pudding with golden plum compote and honeycomb - even if it is just for the melt in your mouth honeycomb pieces.The service on the whole is satisfactory, probably due to how constantly busy they are. However, my only gripe is that they add on the 12.5% service charge to your bill. I'm no Scrooge, but I do like to be my own judge of how much tip I give on any given day. So for that reason, Mildreds is 1 star shy of the full 5.

photos.caption: Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom. Creamy sweet potato and plum tomato curry with pea basmati and lime pickle
Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom. Vanilla rice pudding with golden plum compote and honeycomb.

3m9HInRC46P5X3-diBcGPg.text: I've been coming to Mildred's for years, although I'm not a fully fledged veggie, I do enjoy dining out at vegetarian restaurants (I just can't give up drunken late night burgers and bacon hangover sandwiches).Mildred's is always packed, it's small and has a buzzy Soho vibe - you can't make reservations, so if I'm coming for dinner at the weekend, I'll get here early.  They also have a couple of  tables outside, which is nice for lunch in the summer - a great spot for people watching.They have daily specials, and the menu always has the option of salads, a curry dish, pasta dish, burrito, tagine, and my fave, a veggie burger (they have different types that change daily), always to be accompanied by a side of sweet potato fries - stodgy and delicious.If you're looking for a place to have a birthday dinner, ask about the private dining room that they have upstairs - I've used it before for a birthday, it's free to hire and you can bring an ipod and play your own music.I've dined at Mildred's with many non vegetarians, and everyone always agrees that the food is great and good value for money.

8sn7tWycWIJfvyk-hC1ouw.text: Absolutely loved the flavours in the food and versatility of the menu. Been here twice and enjoyed he food however the table service was a bit poor. On both occasions the waiters forgot a main meals and side plates. Once was ok but the second time was just a bit average.

jAxcfnibPq2eNof50m-FaA.text: If you are in London you have to go to Mildred's. The food is incredible and the waiters are hot. It's a must for any vegan/vegetarian.

rvIwaUPzkTIk6TZs7HSc7A.text: The food is great, very tasty. The service was very bad. They ordered different plates and forgot drinks and ignored us many times. Later I heard that is quite common for places in London to have bad service... Order the icecream for dessert!

1fbS_dwwZIEyR8sI_h_0XQ.text: Absolutely Wonderful! Great service! Incredible food!! Vegan Ice Cream! Better than and I have had!

photos.caption: Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom

ayzoFk9G8HpeqbqjzRCTcg.text: This place makes choosy vegetarians happy. Yes, that's it.It's small, so be ready to wait or just go as soon as it opens on weekdays.You are welcome.

VDpmIWvf0DPlbqjGYNH86g.text: Great ambiance - fun people - great food.We had 2 large dishes - the Sri Lankan dish was amazingThey have organic juice too and that tasted good.Great pice.

05rSwRlsfc6JCCUxdyyk2A.text: Let's be honest: the thought of a vegetarian restaurant didn't get the taste buds tingling....but boy was I wrong! Unlike many places, they don't try and make things like their may based counterparts. The food is wholesome and good. Not too much on the menu. They also have lots of vegan and gluten free options. A definite place I'll be revisiting.

photos.caption: Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom. Gluten free chocolate and Peanut Butter brownie with vanilla ice cream.

qgPptlHA_pHhPk6qEIEjZQ.text: Although it was very crowded, the food was worth the wait! The salads are spectacular with different flavors and textures. If I lived in London, I would go here all the time.

KE94QtPB1AiJGyCR1Mm1CA.text: Are you Veggie-head? Vegan? Annoyingly gluten free? Well then, we have a place for YOU and all your friends to enjoy a meal out without it getting weird or awkward with a barrage of questions like "is this organic?" or "Is there palm oil in this?" I had the sri lankan curry and it was MASSIIIIIIIVE. Just huge and awesome. It was a ton of carbs, rice, and lots of sweet potato, which ended up in feeling like a belly bomber, but over all the food coming out of the kitchen looked great and there were a ton of different types of food. Ranging from salads, to some meats, to mexican to pretty much anything under the sun.

BScHlfxGYI6acBU7n5u7BQ.text: Heaven is a bowl of sweet potato fries from Mildred's. With the basil mayo. Just the right amount of crispy edge and squishy centre. Now if you don't read any further at least I've told you that ;)This is a v popular veggie place in Soho with the omnivore seal of approval. Whatever your x-free diet you'll still have decent choice, and they're v happy to tweak things (ask for the vegan version of the aforementioned mayo if needed!).Last week we skipped starters - personally looked a little pricey to me (over £6 for 4 gyozas?). Mains are around the £10 mark and nicely varied; we had a mix at the table with bean burritos and sausage+mash disappearing rapidly around me. I had the burger of the day (a tasty kidney bean and tofu creation) with the sweet potato marvels, washed down with organic cider. Having not been for a while I'd forgotten that the portions are massive so it felt pretty heavy. May have been my own fault for snacking whilst waiting for the table, woops.Speaking of which, you can't book ahead nor sit down until everyone's arrived, and there's always a ton of people waiting. Leave your name with the guy avec ipad at the door. Personal highlight of the evening was his classic 'brown guys all look the same' mistake, after he took details from one of my mates, went to check availability, then came back and replied to a different guy! *facepalm*We had a good giggle about that during our 45min wait. For the sake of your blood pressure I recommend escaping the sardines can of the bar area and heading for a drink elsewhere (or they have outdoor ping pong in nearby Golden Square atm!). Make sure you head back on time though.We sat downstairs this time and boy it was loud, as each closely-packed table seemed to be trying to outdo its neighbours - unless you fancy reverting to hand signals, be prepared to join in! Our server was v friendly and chatty, and helped my mate choose a dish in a way that felt very genuine, before joking at the end that he should've just pushed the priciest dish - nice that he didn't.Empty plates and (over)full tummies all round at the end (once I'd hoovered up everyone else's remaining sweet potato fries). The only thing we regretfully left was half a mate's elderflower martini which he'd seemed surprised to find was mostly gin... hmm yeah not sure what he was expecting!

ay4qtKwTLFO0lZIE1IyQeQ.text: I was excited to visit this popular vegetarian/vegan restaurant for a long time. Twice I had tried my luck with getting a table in the evening but then didn't want to wait that long. The third time I went there for a weekday lunch and had to wait for only about ten minutes. Unfortunately I was quite disillusioned the moment I stepped into the narrow dining room. The photographs on the website make the place look much nicer than it is.It's nice to have a menu full of veggie choices but the menu isn't really exciting or special. I ordered a Mushroom Ale Pie with Chips and Mushy Peas - bad idea! The chips and peas are not worth mentioning but the pie was really not enjoyable at all. It had a weird bitter taste.I don't think I'll go again. I'd rather accept a more resticted choice of veggie dishes but at least have a more exciting and tasteful experience.

Qxq5isbjNlXovi-Y2Q332g.text: Managed to get a table at this popular spot straight away early on a Thursday evening. We were sat upstairs, which didn't have the buzz and feel of the main downstairs dining area but was nice nonetheless with open sash windows letting Soho in. You can get a drink at the bar while you wait for a table, if you like.We shared an antipasti starter for two between the five of us and all enjoyed the selection on it - great mozzarella, tomatoes, courgette strips and more. For my main I had the wild mushroom pie which came with a good portion of chips and peas. All of us were happy with our meals, veggies and non veggies alike, and between us we only made it through about half the wide ranging menu! I left very happy and very stuffed. Some of the best veggie food I've had in a long time. I'll be back.

j5EFAvEL5DJoNPMRVMIFtA.text: When I went here with my sister, we couldn't believe how busy this place was for a vegetarian restaurant! But after our experience here, we realized it's because this restaurant serves delicious food that appeals to vegetarians and meat eaters alike.We split the pan-fried halloumi, with cherry tomato and wilted spinach with balsamic glaze to start. It was extremely flavourful, and the balsamic glaze was the perfect accent.For my entree I had the detox salad, which was a huge portion of grated beets, carrots, sprouts, and seeds. I also added tofu, which disappointingly was not marinated or cooked. My salad itself was good, but I think I would have preferred a smaller portion as a starter rather than my entree. The flavours got pretty boring after a while.My sister's sunblushed tomato, mozzarella and basil risotto cake with wilted spinach, green beans and grape mustard cream sauce was incredible though! The richness of this meal is extremely satisfying and makes you forget it doesn't even have meat in it.

photos.caption: Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom. sunblushed tomato, mozzarella and basil risotto cake with wilted spinach, green beans and grape mustard cream sauce
Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom. organic detox salad with beets, carrots, fennel, sprouting beans, sultanas, coriander and toasted seeds with apple
Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom. panfried halloumi, cherry tomato and wilted spinach with balsamic glaze

P48ZnWCkwHn482C9fY2-dQ.text: This place isn't bad, but I want to balance out the superlatives a little bit. We had to wait for one hour and twenty minutes while we were told to wait for 45. Once we were seated, the interior was cozy but cramped. I had the classic burger with a side of sweet potato fries. The fries were great, but the burger's not all it's cracked up to be. It was okay. I avoid meat whenever I can, but almost every veggie burger pales in comparison to the original. Mildred's burger was nice, but plain, as is often the case. Although I have had some great veggie burgers, Mildred's sadly wasn't among them.

MTurODju-UCbTiDKs0WiZA.text: I have to admit that I wasn't thrilled to go to a vegetarian restaurant, but one of our friends had requested Mildreds and so we went with it.  To my surprise, Mildreds was really good!Food: We ordered the Mexican platter and panfried halloumi to share for appetisers.  For entrees we ordered the detox salad with goat cheese, the burrito and two jack burgers with fries.  I ordered the burrito which was super delicious and I highly recommend it! Drinks: We ordered four bellinis and two fresh juices.Price: For four people we paid 102.77 GBP. Ambiance: The restaurant is busy on the weekends so be ready to wait.  It's loud and the seating is tight.  Note: The bar doesn't serve anything but bread and olives so you can't order apps while waiting.  The restaurant seems popular with younger people.  There was a large group of young people next to us who were incredibly loud and obnoxious. Even though we were only a group of four it was very hard to hear what we were saying even though we were sitting next to each other.   Service: The service was ok.  The hostess and the server weren't the most friendly.   Would I go back?  Yes, but I would go early to have a pleasant dinner and not have to deal with the noise level because the food is actually very good and is the saving grace of this restaurant.

fU5FV3z0KgDGfyF-lWD9gQ.text: Words can't describe how delicious this place is! I went here with my sister who was visiting from California and this was by far her favorite place we ate!We started with the soup of the day which was carrot ginger and it was delicious! The waitress was so friendly and nice and the food came quickly. My main was the highlight. I got the ricotta and pumpkin stuffed ravioli with mushroom cream sauce and omg... best pasta dish I have EVER had in my life! SO INCREDIBLE! My sister got the curry which she also throughly enjoyed however after she tried my dish, she ordered one for herself too! Been back a number of times and the service is always great. Definitely my favorite vegetarian place in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom. Pumpkin and ricotta stuffed ravioli with mushroom cream sauce. So good my friend got it as well!

3R_YgODCt1LoZ_JdJraUOQ.text: Just go here. Best vegitarian restaurant around. Love the food. Love the venue. Dive in, a welcome retreat from the crowds and commercialization of Oxford St, Regent St and well London.

QbTepBywkrrb0ODsaigXfw.text: The place is packed, even on an early weekday evening.Foodwise, I have to downgrade to 3 stars. We had 4 in our group. Everyone thought the food was just OK but nothing special. Halloumi starter was good but main course of mushroom and leek pie with mash and kale was a bit boring and bland. My dessert of banoffee creme brulee, salted caramel bananas and choc chip shortbread sounded better than what I ate. We sat upstairs, the air became really stuffy and ventilation was severely lacking. The noise of a group of boisterous people in the next room was annoying so at the end of the meal I was relieved to get outside again.

c3Tp_dBECEUPg9xVhSZNHA.text: As the Yelp stars suggest: this place is a-ok.And I feel like a jerkball (technical term) because so many respected Yelp-voices seem to love Mildred's.  So let's agree that I need to give it a second chance, ok?  Maybe I made a fatal mistake by not going for the much-celebrated risotto cake.First off: love the space.  Love that it cozily overflows at lunch time, and yet doesn't super-shoo me through my plates.  Also - as Kat F. keenly observed - it's a 'cool'/'non-weird' (ha) veggie/vegan-friendly place.  I'm a veggie lover, and my lunch buddy is borderline vegan, and we were happy as (soy protein based) clams.  Fresh beet and orange juice: LIKE DRINKING STRAIGHT DELICIOUS VITAMINS.I had the gyoza to start because I'm a sucker for a dumpling.  They were...not great, especially at the price of roughly a pound/each.  They were really small and the skins weren't sealed so it was impossible to dip them into the (delicious, note) chili sauce without all the innards falling out.  Dumpling architecture was off.We also had some guacamole and chips, which was totally fine.  Really lime-y (which I like!) and smooth (which I don't!).  Fair portion, I guess, but it was just...chips and gauc.As a main I was trying to keep my careening-towards-holiday-excesses promise to myself and had the detox salad.  Beet and carrot and seeds and fennel and some leaves all tossed together in a lime vinaigrette.  A lot of crunching; it was a nice, clean salad.  Energising.  Nice pile of crunch.I think what derailed the mood a little was one server who seemed to roll their eyes at any/everything.  It was kindof funny, but I don't know what set it off: stressful service? The rolling was in high gear when three separate tables requested tables different from the ones they were given (can fully sympathise that this would be frustrating within a small restaurant, but an obvious huffy eye-roll doesn't help, either).Yelp note: the neighbouring table had the burger of the day with massive wedged sweet potato fries.  Their plates looked BOMBDOTCOM.

SV5zzjJGl-k6fvLwefJyGg.text: Mildreds is a cozy restaurant, located on Lexington street. I didn't have to queue and sat at a spacious table. The waitress was polite and gave me plenty of time to order. I ordered stir fried asian vegetables. Not amazing but not bad. I have nothing dazzling to say about Mildreds but nothing horrible either. I'll probably come back and order a special.

photos.caption: Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom. Stir fried Asian vegetables with organic brown rice and tofu, topped with cashew nuts

zD8IdsnurC24ab_foQoDEQ.text: Disappointing food, environment, and service.Mushrooms were pretty tough, the pie they were in left a lot to be desired. Portions fairly small, especially the ravioli. Restaurant fairly loud and crowded, but that might be standard for the neighborhood.

2AOFBzFJUCDwyuP5dPELWw.text: Having read reviews about the long waits and small dining area I had my apprehensions about dining at Mildred's, fortunately the overwhelming compliments towards the food was enough to spark my curiosity and subside the lack of patience of my hunger. There was only a thirty minute wait and we probably did not even wait for that long, however I don't doubt that queues line up out of the door for a seat.Mildred's Its self is a little cramped (you may find yourself sharing a table with other diners) and at present seems to have some renovations happening but the atmosphere is brilliant, you can see everyone's food arriving at their tables which gives you a bad case of food envy, but that only makes the arrival of your food more enjoyable (or making time to pay up and leave more difficult) and speaking of food it was some of the best vegetarian food I've ever had, the prices are more than reasonable for the quality and quantity, I want to go back and try everything, you'll experience the same.

photos.caption: Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom. Mildred's Buffalo tofu, crumbed and fried with Buffalo sauce, crudites and blue cheese dip.
Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom. Mildred's Portobello, Wild Mushroom and Ale pie with minted Peas and (phenomenal) fries.

DILCcJDbDaJRI7R9Zb039A.text: So delicious and so many things to like about this place. For one, it's vegetarian. Two, constantly busy, but we managed to get seated relatively quickly.  Three, we were never rushed. Four, did I already mention delicious?I went with the smoked tofu, apple and bean sausages, essentially their version of bangers and mash. The sausages held together nicely, mashed potato was fantastic, and so was the kale. Washed it down with a banana, honey and soya milk smoothie. I also ate a big part of my friend's dessert: coconut black rice pudding with mango compote and coconut flakes. Heavenly, and not super sweet, which I appreciated even more.Probably my favorite meal in London. Dishoom was a very close second. Thank goodness this was recommended in my guidebook!

HQBBSIizReW5WSzSKnCntg.text: Even non-veggies will love the food here - simply wonderful. Get there early as they don't take bookings and it can get busy. Well worth the wait, and can highly recommend the burgers, and the smoothies are yummy. Watch out though, as they don't take credit cards (they do accept Maestro and Connect). mildreds.co.uk

cg78OVnYZPVgIIUG6jkEsg.text: Popped in on Saturday afternoon - fab food and very laid back - would thoroughly recommend. I had the burger but the best thing was the fries - big, crisp on the outside and fluffy inside - mmmmm, delish!!!

270QmULUK3xedOn3r6NyRg.text: what is it about veggie restaurants being far too small? this lot have moved a few times to a (seems to be) smaller venue but within the Soho area. the small venue puts pressure on the diner, get there early to get a table - 5pm on most days - , you cant book a table, you cant be seated until the rest of your party arrives and then you get the bill before you've finished eating your desert as the queue is out the door. having said that, the food is amazing and varied and has been a long time favourite of mine - 12 years - so go for the experience. Wagamama's is across the road if you cant be bothered to wait

lfJ-V08sasQfT9j_38tuhQ.text: Oh WOW! I wanna start by the inside of it, it's just a super nice, cozy and cute space great for go for a date or with your family. The staff is super friendly and they make you feel so welcome.They have a good food variety on the menu, it goes to burgers to dim sum to curry to sir fry ... it all sounds so delicious! I got the Sir fry which as WOW! really good and my boyfriend got the burger also amazing! They have a lot of vegan options there and plates that can me easily be turned into vegan by request. I wish that by in the end of the meal I had space for dessert which sounded great but guess I'll need to go back ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom. Sir fry and burger

ufpbu96TbLW9NhchMYPrfg.text: As a vegetarian, Mildreds has been on my radar for quite some time. The few times I have tried to get a table have been Friday/Saturday nights, and I was put off by the hour-long queue.I finally managed to go to Mildred's outside of the restaurant's peak hours at 4pm on a Friday, there were several tables available but the place was still busy.With regards to ambiance, there is very little. Mildred's is quite noisy and has no windows, I really like natural light unless the restaurant can compensate with cosy candles etc.I had already consulted the menu and knew that I was going to go for the vegan mushroom and ale pie with chips and mushy peas. The butternut squash curry that my partner opted for looked really good but I wanted to stick with my original choice, as vegetarian pies are harder to come by.When the pie arrived, I felt an initial disappointment. It was not a pot pie but rather some very watery gravy topped with some puff pastry-it didn't even seem homemade. The chips were good but too fried. My partner's curry was good once you added the coconut chilli, but nothing extraordinary. For £11, the meal was quite disappointing in all honesty. Pie minster or Clives pies offerings are better than what I had here, and much cheaper. I looked at the pudding menu but didn't feel particularly inspired by the brownie and cheesecake offerings. I won't be back in a hurry.

photos.caption: Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom. Mushroom and ale pie

QoH2qrB5O7hwzDC6Gz93-Q.text: Delicious, delicious food but dinking one star because it is served lukewarm and our waitress was bitchy. I got the pumpkin, ricotta and sage tortelloni with wild mushroom marsala cream sauce as a starter- again, wonderful flavour but it was also small even for a starter portion. The chargrilled cauliflower with tahini lemon dressing and pomegranate seeds- same. My friend and I shared a special dessert: a pecan pud with a scoop of ice cream that was so yum. However, we were charged twice for it and while the manager gladly took it off, he also said, "Oh I wouldn't even have noticed!" Uhhhhh that doesn't make me feel any better =/I would love to try many other options on the menu and will probably return just will keep my expectations lower. Also, keep in mind the place is TINY and it is LOUD so it's not the most relaxing experience.

fU8UBb8x0bsoQe1mShoRYg.text: I've been to Mildred's a few times - the first being 6 years ago - and it is still the best vegan food in London. It's gotten hugely more popular (and crowded), but for good reason. You can't make reservations so if you show up on a weekend night expect to wait at least an hour. You can have a drink at the bar while you wait; my aperol spritz was refreshing after a full day of sight-seeing. I ordered the mushroom and ale pie with chips and mushy peas. As an American, I just can't understand mushy peas. But if one must eat them, these are a fine representation. The chips were perfect and the pie was very good. It's not the best dish I've had at Mildred's, but very good nonetheless. Dessert stole the show. It was a mixed berry polenta crumble. It tasted nothing like the polenta I know, and complemented the berries wonderfully. The creme anglaise served in a tiny pitcher to be poured in was a slight miss. It didn't have the richness of a traditional creme anglaise, and it being vegan is no excuse. There are plenty of rich dairy substitutes; the recipe just needs to be tweaked. I'm really splitting hairs, though, as this is still the best vegan restaurant in London despite several new additions to the vegan scene. Hopefully they take it as an opportunity to up their game and make just a few minor tweaks to make this restaurant a solid 10/10.

photos.caption: Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom

4pP5KtN6KjMhDbYckToGfg.text: Very nice atmosphere!! the food is just amazing, even for meat lovers like the friend I went with. We had 2 appetizers (halloumi is delicious!!) and one main each (burrito and stir vegetables and brown rice!)overall a full 5!!

vxkOjGWR3OTKfjP3xnoc8g.text: I went here a while back with a vegan friend of mine, and it was so good!! I'm not vegan or vegetarian myself and was hoping that most of the food wasn't going to be RAW THIS and ROUGHAGE THAT, as most vegan places seem to be, at least in my opinion. This was far from it!! I had the bean burrito dish and it was SO GOOD. It was incredibly filling too!! Absolutely packed with beans and cheese and tasty goodness. Deffo worth it for non-veggies/vegans if you're looking to feel a bit healthier about what you're eating. :p

photos.caption: Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom. My dish: Bean burrito  Hers: Veggie burger

WqruiMufEy6KYXI0loQpEA.text: Had a great meal here with cousins while in London.   Great atmosphere and original vegetarian good.   Great place to check out if visiting London.

3SoICYlI1V55AuDMk_-odA.text: Nice veggie/vegan restaurant for lunch. Space is small but beautiful with the skylight. Service was very friendly and fast.The only thing that was a bit disappointing was the food. Side of sweet potato chips were very good. My friend and I had the risotto cake (basically deep-fried risotto) and the burrito. The filling of my burrito was good, maybe a bit on the dry side. Wrap was undercooked on the bottom and the whole thing was smothered in cheese, just a bit too much. Guac that came with it was ok but nothing special and iceberg salad as a side was just disappointing for a vegetarian restaurant. Overall decent food but lacking in imagination.

y8zunyAKv1zLq0iPRU7b2g.text: Best Vegan food experienced in London!  First time eating at Mildred's and highly recommend for vegans and non vegans. Atmosphere noisy and friendly. Full of energy and worth the wait. Service was great and the food was mouth watering!  I ate the sweet potato curry dish after a customer recommended.  Will return before leaving London!

6WJy37zYiqWLotbuL1QWig.text: Recently I have tried to eat less meat and more vegetarian when eating out or cooking at home. Halloumi, paneer, cereals & quorn substitutes are the new ingredients in my cupboard and fridge. With good vegetables and sauces I realised that meat free dishes can be as good and tasty as meat dishes.To embrace my new found interest in veggie food, I went out for dinner at Mildred's with two friends. Opened since 1988, Mildred's serves only vegetarian food. It was my first time at Mildred's, while my vegetarian friend is a regular there. I really liked my dinner at Mildred's I didn't miss meat at all. All options sounded great, It took a bit of time to choose what we wanted qnd it was a really good value. We were all too full to get a dessert. We saw some cake on the table next to us that looked delicious, maybe next time I won't eat too much from the starter to leave some place for dessert.Service was good, not special but they were at least attentive to details which is a good thing considering they were extremely busy (apparently it is like that every day).

photos.caption: Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom. Fresh tortellini filled with pumpkin and ricotta, with chestnut mushroom, white wine cream sauce, drizzled with truffle oil
Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom. Mixed mushroom, porcini and ale pie with mushy peas and fries or mash
Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom. Fresh tagliatelle with creamy basil and goat's cheese sauce with butternut squash and sweet potato

xljG8hhzXveGry8diqkQgg.text: Great vegan friendly food that's tasty, well presented and lively atmosphere. Traveling here solo, I enjoyed a delicious cashew curry with sweet potatoes and spicy sauce on the side. The tofu buffalo was bland and the ranch side was dull- maybe that's what ranch dressing does. Drinks are very reasonably priced and wait wasn't long. Their scheme of giving you a card to use at bar and then transfer to table is smart. I'll be back!

cj5Sihg3lixW1EnusswgNg.text: Wow is this place popular! We arrived just as it opened last Saturday and within half an hour, it was heaving. After tasting the food, I could see what all the hype was about. The halloumi burger was absolutely delicious, crispy and full of flavour and the sweet potato fries were insane. Sweet chunky slabs of potato, sprinkled with salt. Delicious. The dessert was also incredible, I went for a peanut butter brownie with chocolate sauce. Not gonna lie, I was a bit skeptical because it was gluten free and wheat free and previous experiences haven't been that good with similar products, but I definitely had nothing to worry about. The brownie was rich and melted in your mouth, with the chunks of peanut butter to add the finishing touch. The vanilla ice cream on the side was fresh and tasted like it had come straight from a vanilla pod.Not the cheapest place, but an ideal place to go for lunch, if you vegetarian and its that good, meat eaters will happy to come along for the ride.

photos.caption: Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom. Halloumi burger and sweet potato fries
Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom. Chocolate and peanut butter brownie

bCfb4iPoJoq51tuC2LTJYA.text: Mildred's offers a variety of dishes with international influences and with the options of vegan, gluten-free and wheat-free meals. They do not take reservations and the wait sometimes could be long, but it is well worth it. While waiting you can take advantage of their bar from wine to beer and specialty created cocktails.One of their main dishes I recommend is the Sri Lankan sweet potato and cashew nut curry. The dish is nicely presented with big sweet chunks of sweet potatoes with yellow basmati rice with green peas topped with cilantro and chopped cashews in a cashew nut curry. The flavor of the curry was complex with flavors of coconut, cardamom, turmeric and curry leaves with the chopped sweet cashews. The thick tomato sambal on the side had tomato, cilantro and a hint of coconut that provides freshness to the dish.As for dessert, I had their sticky toffee pudding. Their take on the sticky toffee pudding is presented like a slice of cake as oppose to most of the other versions of the pudding which were served as a circular shape drenched in sauce. It had a cake-like texture rather than a soaked pudding. The rich and sweet sauce was lightened by the sweet cream served on the side.Good food and a great staff. A true gem to dine at. I would definitely return to Mildreds next time I am back in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom. Sticky Toffee Pudding
Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom. Sri Lankan Sweet Potato and Cashew Nut Curry

Mt3PVVo1j_BteR8_mHPjbw.text: Great vegetarian food in a great location. Definitely a pick-me-up from the normal British food we'd been experiencing on our trip. It was really busy, even mid-week, but worth it.

eVR3r54nkSh96AhuMsrIcw.text: I had one of my best all time favourite meals at this Mildreds. I met a friend here she thought I would like it as there are many gluten free options, and its food made with love. I got a fresh kale, mint, cucumber and apple juice which was nice and light. For food I had the thai tofu fritters with melon and coconut sauce and my friend had the dumplings. The fritters were delightful. Soft, light, fluffy and very tasty, they don't taste like tofu at all it was surprising, the melon and coconut sauce balanced it out perfectly. Next we had the asian vegetable stir fry with brown rice. This too was very tasty, vegetables were crispy.Mildreds also has a great salad bar which is good for a cheap and healthy take away lunch. The staff are busy, there is limited seating at lunch time because its so popular!

photos.caption: Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom. Sweet potato frites
Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom. Dumplings
Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom. Asian vegetable stir fry

RIeFJ2n4d6SFLwUNt9HI9A.text: Pros: great service, great food, no wait for 2 when we arrived at 5:45Cons: tight seating!Evidently they have improved their service because we really enjoyed our servers. We ordered the antipasto plate and the portobello pie, and both exceeded our expectations. Overall great experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom. Portobello pie and sweet potato fries...mushy peas were best ever!

vsjsqDCOJkWbKoDQksnt4Q.text: FOOD & DRINKSI had the sri lankan sweet potato and cashew nut curry. It was a good curry. Fresh and healthy.SERVICEThe service staff was attentive, friendly and nice. Nothing to complain at all.ATMOSPHEREYou can sit at the bar and have some finger food and drinks or go to the back end and sit down and have some veggie meal. We went here to have some nice dinner. The place is quite small and the noise level high but it still is nice and chilly. If you intend to have a romantic dinner I'd rather recommend some place else.RATINGI recommend this place to get a nice veggie meal and some drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom. sri lankan sweet potato and cashew nut curry

RC_jWNkwh7VRNFQGKdb-6Q.text: Vegetarians, rejoice! Here's a restaurant to take your meat-loving, comfort-food craving friends!Well, that is, unless your friends are addicted to meat, in which case they might still have some withdrawal symptoms. But you'll be in Soho, so it's not like you'll be without post-meal options if they're desperate.Mildreds may be vegetarian, but it has plenty of dishes that are hearty, filling, and sizeably portioned. I love and definitely recommend the risotto cake, burrito, and some of the pasta specials they've offered. Hubby loves the Sri Lankan curry. Desserts are amaaaaazing, so do leave room for those! (we've had cheesecakes and creme brulees and they were yummy!) The one dish I was disappointed by was the sweet potato fries, which were more like wedges. But others seem to really like them, so it's up to you!The space is tight and it can get quite noisy, but it's a friendly atmosphere with attentive and helpful staff. You can't make reservations, so expect to wait 45 minutes to an hour for your table. If you have a bigger group, come early or come at a quieter hour to get seated more quickly.

photos.caption: Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom. Sri Lankan curry
Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom. Risotto cake deliciousness!

7Fl7MrCDr8xkpnkBNZ6_4A.text: Pretty good vegan option! Cool crowd. Very crowded in the evening so better to arrive early.

vQZTkc_V1-pLBUWbNxBqHg.text: Great restaurant. Great staff. Charming space!Came in close to closing and was still received pleasantly. Really enjoyed the halloumi appetizer-- highly recommend this!! They also prepare amazing pasta here.

uSOR57bYZhBaljMeONwedw.text: Came here with a friend whilst out for the night in London , neither of us are veggie but had heard great things . Was very busy which we took for a great sign and was very grateful for the plugs there to get a quick charge ! Was shown to our seats by very pleasant staff and took in the nice layout overlooked by a picture of the queen . Ordered a black bean and tomatillo burrito , was really nice and a huge portion I couldn't finish . Once I got over a few of the veggie and vegan replacements the food was really good and had a pleasant evening . Also as a plus was pleasantly surprised when I checked the bill !!

KY6RFKJi0ulteFTZ48YlDA.text: Great restaurant! I went for the first time in 2011 and then came back in 2013, longing for the tasty food and friendly staff!! You'll never be disppointed! I recommend the hamburguers (OMG, halloumi cheese is so good) and the stir fried veggies (asian style).

r285sxI4PRBQ_FOMez9dGA.text: I came here a couple of weeks ago with a friend after adopting a vegan diet (we decided to try out a few vegan places together to see which were good!).After quite a wait (midday on one of the weekend days if I remember correctly) they noticed we were standing (after 10 mins or so) and seated us. The whole restaurant is very narrow and cramped, you sit in canteen-y rows, which I didn't like. The atmosphere was very dry and the place was stuffed with irritating people (the kind who are trying desperately to make their conversations as audible to as many outsiders as possible). There actually weren't too many vegan options to be honest - I settled on a sweet potato curry. The sweet potato curry was perfectly balanced in terms of seasoning but the chef had obviously decided that it would be a good idea to use an entire can of coconut cream as its base. The result was a very fatty and overly rich sauce with chunks of sweet potato in it (the person next to me ordered the same dish and they too only managed to get through half of it).My friend had a burrito which was a very uninspiring wrap stuffed with kidney beans - she also detested the food / place.The staff were distracted and bored. Overall I was disappointed with every aspect of it. Definitely won't be back.

QkjPerLVJ8E-5z1m2Pz05g.text: Mildred's offers proper comforting, hearty 'like your momma use to make if she had accepted your vegetarianism and knew a world away from turkey drumsticks' food. I go to Mildred's a lot because its yummy. My most recent visit was at a friends *cough*44th*cough* and she'd booked out the private room upstairs. It was nice, clean, away from the hustle and bustle of what is normally the mega busy and cramped downstairs. There is a min spend, but we all covered that no problem. The food smells divine, looks scrummy, good portion sizes and is just Moorish. Trying to avoid naughty carbs (with my usual choice being the ale and mushroom pie which I really recommend) I had a Tagine with cous cous. Spicy sauce on the side and a bit of flat bread it was just perfect. I couldn't handle the desert, but they looked nice and from the orgasmic sounds everyone else was making, its a good sign.It's got a good organic wine list, nice selection of beers and cocktails. The waiter may have accidentally mistaken my partner as my mother, but ... that's just plain funny.

WhijRWyW5BV3Nz6XmKjT8A.text: Loved Mildred's! As a quasi-vegan from San Francisco, I've been on the hunt for solid vegetarian food in London (preferably something other than Indian). So, I was delighted to find Mildred's. We went on a Friday night and it was jam-packed. But the service was excellent -- we were able to get a drink while we waited and the wait staff took extra good care of us. My friend tried the mushroom pie with mushy peas. The dish was a little on the salty side, but very good. We LOVED the sweet potato fries as a starter... and I tried the vegan special version of bangers and mash. Oh, and save room for pudding! It will be hard, but you won't regret it when you bite into the fruit crumble and vegan ice cream.Thank goodness for you, Mildred... and your vegetarian ways. I'll be back soon.

RXPtSU7WV3Qne48VD_tH-g.text: I've had a variety of great and terrible experiences here. And that does seem to be the norm these days. The food is overall really nice, it's the service that can be lacking.Last year was the worst. At lunch we waited longer for food than everyone around who ordered after us, was brought the wrong food, the correct food was cold and with hair in it. Not even a "sorry" from the staff, just bitterness. And that's why I haven't been back in a year.Last week I took a gaggle of out-of-towners for dinner here because it has something for everyone and it was DELIGHTFUL! Excellent and attentive service, great ambiance, didn't wait very long, the food was superb- wowing the sceptical omnivores to the jaded vegans! It has absolutely renewed my faith in them and I will definitely be bringing friends here for the dinner service!

LgccOQC-Ubk8yzCZYfNYcg.text: While visiting London, my friend brought us to Mildred's.  So good.  I really liked the food.  The sweet potato fries were yummy - it looked like everyone had ordered some to share.  The restaurant is a little small, and it was packed full of people.  It wasn't too uncomfortable, though.  The service was fine.  Not what most Americans would call attentive, but good according to London standards.  My husband and I decided that if we lived in London, we would visit Mildred's quite often.

photos.caption: Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom. Yummy curry!

qBSXgiWc4XfgJEtWQzYOGw.text: This was my second meeting with an all vegetarian restaurant and like the last encounter this was like my rating, A-OK!!We had a two starters to share, the special cheese fondue and a grilled halloumi salad! don't get me wrong I love my cheese however the cheese fondue was very strong the the cheese was very grainy! its very hard to get a grilled halloumi wrong and thank god they didn' t, the dressing was fantastic it really brought the whole dish together, the saltiness of the halloumi with the sweetness of the tomato and the balsamic dressing.For the main I had the burrito filled with spicy black turtle beans, corn, red pepper and green tomatillo rice,  topped with spicy sauce and cheddar served with iceberg, sour cream, guacamole and pico de gallo. However the food was very bland and tasteless!Having dinner with a group of girls and we of course had dessert, we had the raspberry and dark chocolate truffle and salted caramel, hazelnut and chocolate cheesecake. The truffle was ordinary, the dusting of chocolate left a weird taste in your mouth. But the cheesecake was fantastic! the salted caramel was great!I would definitely recommend this restaurant on the following conditions, 1. catching up with friends2. if you have vegetarian friends The service was slow but the staff was great fun!

NTU4zqVEMAxqc_Uw93bNUw.text: We had a great meal here at this cute, fun restaurant in Soho! Started with Med Platter which was great then got the detox salad and sweet potato curry. The curry was really delicious and rich and the salad was light and flavorful. We even bought their new cookbook to try and recreate some of these dishes back home. Must try for all veggies!

iUml7E6Ta2CPRRcIcZSv2Q.text: Awesome place for Vegetarian food. Wide range on the menu. The tortellini was fantastic.

Hwj1MSql1gFxkfBGE7OwKw.text: Delightful find Stumbled upon this quaint restaurant walking through Soho.  Delicious, pumpkin stuffed tortellini was to die for...detox salad - fresh, crunchy and my husband's curry, sweet and spicy.  Highly recommend.

A3mKHgVhWiXJuaAF9MRoNg.text: See this is why I hate going to the same place more than once. Its like a drug or something, its never going to be good as your first hit. The queue was horrendous because there's no where to chill as its so cramped...the staff were all very friendly and efficient though so made it more bearable. I feel I just made the wrong choices tonight which annoyed me a bit because I was really hungry and had been looking forward to it all day. I had the detox salad which was nothing special or exactly the most exciting dish on the menu and sweet potato fries as a side dish and gotta be honest....don't get why everyone is gassing them up so much! Plain to me. The pornstar Martini was good to be fair.

QcadLkTgOC76QLQqRt2rmw.text: Probably my favourite restaurant in London. The staff who've served me have always been great (especially the Brazilian guy who gave me free sweet potato fries - lovely man!), the food is always delicious and the atmosphere is great, but I prefer to sit at the window at the front rather than being seated amongst all the other diners in the main room. Some of the dishes are a little overpriced but generally the prices are good. They make a mean burger, and wicked fries.

cMPsv068qYUjLlbHPKNafw.text: I absolutely loved this place.  There was something for everyone.  Very quaint cute place.  Even my picky kid found a dish she liked with a protein so I was happy.  They have a great veggie burger.  Thick steak cut fries (or chips!), and tasty apps, soups, pasta, sandwiches, cakes, etc.  Came back twice on our trip to the city.  It was priced appropriately.  I would visit again!

qLw8pf8sTuDd3_JnixMRZQ.text: Delicious food with friendly service. The one downside is how popular this place is. It was packed on a Tuesday night. I had the veggie burger with sweet potato fries. The burger was magnificent and really satisfied my craving. The sweet potato fries were good, but not crispy like in the US. I can't wait to go back here and try more of their tasty offer!

3oGNXYkYKPLbxLI81REDdw.text: Mildred's never ceases to amaze me. I'm not a veggie, but I have quite a few friends who are. I've been here on a number of occasions now and I'd have to say that there's never been a time that I've been disappointed. Sadly, though, I can't rate it 5* because it is pretty simple fare. Tasty, but simple.Anyway, the food is definitely delightful, and the last time I went, I had brought my college best friend who was visiting from LA and a recently turned veggie. We had chatted about this place, mainly because there aren't enough LA veggie restaurants and I was proud to show off the local homage to veggie dining.  Friend has never been stumped for choice since turning veggie and loved the fact that he couldn't quite come to a choice. He settled on the sweet potato curry (which is very good - and a staple on the menu) and I went with the chick pea burger. All in all, Mildred's is a good place to go even if you are an omnivore because the atmosphere is great, the food's good and the wine list decent. 4*s! Will definitely return. And certainly worth the trip.

WlqxHkhJ7tLWuA8KoShe7Q.text: Stellar dinner here. Came on a Saturday night sans reservation and seated within 15 minutes at a shared table (they have non-shared tables too). We had a bottle of wine - an organic Malbec that rang in at just over 20 quid, which was very good value, I thought, as it was a pretty tasty wine (they had sub-20 quid bottles, too). Sweet rather than dry, but that's sometimes nice. We each had a starter, a main and we split a dessert. Starters were dumplings for her and a salad of rocket, blue cheese, figs and walnuts for me; both were great. Mains were the burger with sweet potato fries, and the 'detox' salad, which was lots of carrots and other assorted veggies. For dessert we had the dark chocolate and raspberry truffle, which was delicious and went well with the wine (n.b. I usually think pairing food and wine is a dubious endeavor, but in this case it worked well - good work, us). The whole meal came to a little under 70 quid, which while isn't cheap isn't bad either for a multi-course meal and full bottle of wine. I would definitely return to this place.

cSc47n61ffbkQM-j9_Y0sw.text: I'm not a vegetarian or a vegan, but I really enjoyed the meal I had.  I'd recommend to anyone, but it's very popular so expect a wait.

zhC9m8bvNtH0izYxovo3Jw.text: So I just moved to London temporarily and I've had a tough transition with finding non-greasy proper vegetarian food. Then I stumbled upon Mildreds and I never want to go back to New York City ever again (ok not really I'll be happy to go back there, but wow this place is amazing). I should also say I've hardly been in London for a month and I've already been here twice. First time I had the detox salad and the mint tea. The salad was huge by London portion standards and was very tasty. My only complaint was too many shredded carrots not enough other veggies. The mint was very good as well.But, my second meal was what my me need to write a review. I had the veggie burger of the day with fries that came with basil mayo. Now I don't like mayo, in fact it really grosses me out. But instead of seeing mayo I saw basil goodness. and boy was it basil goodness. The burger was also really good but it was the basil mayo that pulled everything together. I also had a raspberry vanilla lemonade the was crazy good. I don't drink so I'm always happy to find something non-alcholic to drink on the menu that isn't your standard coke, sprite etc. Then I had the passion fruit panna cotta like dessert. Now I should say that panna cotta and all related cream desserts are my favorite. But that being said I'm also incredibly picking about my panna cotta. This passion fruit amazingness at Mildreds was one of the top ones I've had anywhere. It was sosososo good I could really just go back to eat that.Anyways if you are veggie or like veggie friendly food and you are in London you would really be missing out if you didn't hit this place up.

HXd_kcFQ5WhhThfFwuUcrw.text: Sat at a shared table at 5 pm and felt lucky to get in as we were heading to a show at 730 pm. Place was packed. The food was fantastic so not a surprise. I had the mushroom pie, very rich. Enjoyed the mushy peas on the side. My wife got a very tasy pasta dish, bread, and a small salad. All wonderful.

2eR6pj_qr_PYJwPw76vH3w.text: Incredible food, best meal when I visited. Vegan

KEF58NOkN7RznOfiMAOL1A.text: In March I had finally touched down in London for the first time in my life. My friend and her roommate are vegan and were showing me around town. We all have pretty hefty appetites so this was our first stop. At first we were told that the wait would be 20 minutes, but we were seated upstairs within 7. The first level has a greenhouse roof, which allows natural light to seep in and was rather lovely, but we didn't mind heading upstairs.The restaurant is blends rustic, old fashioned, and modern decor and the vibe was very refreshing. We sat down and were given a bottle of spring water in minutes. Since I don't have any restrictions while I'm on vacation, I was open to eating anything. We ordered one of the salads as an appetizer for the table - everything in the menu will make your mouth water. Both the waitress and my friends recommended that I try the wood roasted mushroom and ale pie with minted mushy peas and fries, so I did. It reminded me of home because in my culture we use puff pastry for a number of dishes and this one was filled with a mushroom soup/porridge. The seasoning was on point and I just devoured that portion. The minty mashed peas cooled down thw heat from the mushroom mix and added it's own flare to the serving. I think that was my favorite part of the dish. The fries made me feel guilty, but c'mon...who doesn't like fries? My reason for giving it 4 stars is because I want to return and try their other items. I didn't have enough to fully rate this restaurant, but I'm sure it can be deserving of 5. The service was great as we were checked on every few minutes. Vegan or not, you will leave Mildreds stuffed and with a big smile on your face, especially because it's not detrimental to your bank account! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom. Wood roasted mushroom and ale pie with minted mushy peas and fries

LZs2GazVYx7fjcnjYbrE9A.text: DinnerAre you a sweet potato lover? Then you'll love their curry.Early dinner with my friend who teaches yoga and loves good fresh food and making effort to cut down sugars.It's a convenient place to take friends who is vegetarian or vegan, so every now and then I take friends who are not big fun of meat. Not sure what diet my friend follows but I sensed that she will love this venue. She isn't big fund of meat and loves yoga, fresh juice, loves Asian food then I thought about this place. Both of us had SriLankan sweet potatoes curry. That was divine. Roasted cashew nuts were just the perfect one to be in curry. Portion is giant so we were so right skipping small plates. We were digging in the plate as soon as served on the table. We didn't wait for long. Since it's small place you are hardly neglected. We were so full and couldn't taste desserts afterwards. It's high carb so suggested for someone who works out. I burnt 600kcal in the gym that day. It'll be ideal if it's low fat... (HCLF?)I'm dreaming this curry for days and days.I just NEED to go back and have the same one again.Limited number of the table hence 4 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom

CPuuXw8ChkD9c18ZILgb3A.text: Tasty food and great service. Ordered : negroni , Flying fig, guacamole and gyoza dumplings   Bonus: people watching
