u6R8qoRBVhnZ2vWM5CJN5g.text: Simply amazing and delicious.  A must to visit for vegan food.  Highly recommend the mushroom tart and aubergine.

photos.caption: Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom. Vegan hazelnut brownie with salted caramel sauce and ice cream.

5e4x1pk-CJbWh5ftKv_Nnw.text: I can see why this place gets so many good reviews. It was divine. I had a trio of small plates, the artichokes and grilled bread, the gyoza and the manchego cheese. All were superb in their own right. I would come again in a heartbeat. Excellent service, all dishes recommended by the server. And at 3 pm on a Thursday afternoon it was packed, so you know it's good when it's packed at an odd time like that. Keep it up, Mildreds! Love that you are giving vegetarians and vegans so many delicious options.

dDnj7GxWYyp7EoNB8Ffzlg.text: Honestly skip it... veggie pret across the street has better options. Slow service, cramped tables/seating, exorbitant prices... and the veggie burger wasn't even good!! First and last time at this place :/

XDdbvjvco6wtmALJh5bACg.text: One of my favorite restaurants until today. Waited for 25 minutes or so and nobody even took a drink order. When we asked the manager one came to table rude and pushy. We left for fear of what they would do with our food. Looks like bad management is taking down on of what used to be a great and reliable spot for good food. Sadness.

XKHthu-0Mg1UYMXO4fyMVQ.text: Mildred's is a decent veggie restaurant that offers a global selection of dishes. The dishes we got were good but I'd focus on the cuisines that have a heritage of vegetarian or vegan fare. Gyoza was surprisingly tasty. I really enjoyed this and they were better than some of the Asian restaurants I've been too. The filling had a bit of texture unlike some veggie dumplings which can be quite mushy. Side of Asian broccoli (which was actually tenderstem  broccolini and not gai lan) was well cooked with a nice sweet soy sauce dressing. Nothing special but well prepared. I had the sausage and mash with cabbage as main. This didn't fare so well. Mash and cabbage were comparable to what you'd probably make at home but the sausages tasted too strongly of fennel seeds. One bite could be quite bland but another could fill your mouth with a liquorice taste. Slightly off putting. Overall, the meal was fine. The atmosphere is quite modern which is a nice change from the hippy dippy places that normally make up veggie restaurants.  The dishes seem slightly hit or miss but I'd be open to coming back and trying more.

pMuSokniVL61JElcYf5itw.text: I probably did not come here when I study in London due to that I broke and rarely ate out.  But recently I traveled back to Europe and when I met up with some friends in London they said "Vegetarian...let's got to Mildred's!"Definitely wish I ate here more.  We all got the mozzarella risotto cakes which normally I wouldn't have allowed myself to order the same thing as everyone else at the table, but it was in fact excellent!  VERY filling!  I shared a hummus and babaganoush dish as an appetizer that was also very tasty. The service was excellent, and our waiter was pretty cute as well ;) I see that a lot of people here think that it was loud but I didn't find it too loud, we were able to have our conversations and not have to yell or hear others.  And the servers were not bothered that we stayed there for a LONG time either!We also popped into the bakery next door which is owned by Mildred's, and I had a yummy cupcacke!Sidenote, both places are have very good options for people with ciliac's,

MFIXFevFTvaApOykyJrZew.text: This is a Soho classic. It's been around for ever and serves up really good quality vegetarian food for a mixed crowd. I used to be a vegetarian and both then and now it always guaranteed a really good meal. The menu is pretty balanced, they've got the usual burgers, risottos, salads and chips plus a few more creative, vegan and intolerances tolerant options.The atmosphere is nice too, cosy and light and the staff are really helpful and pretty knowledgeable about the food. Whether you like your animals dead or alive this is a class choice.

photos.caption: Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom

JEv8geGBVnpqKY0DIioUdA.text: This is my favourite restaurant in London. Mainly because the food is great. Also like the casualness of the setup, the service is decent, while not in-your-face and theres a great selection for veges like me. Each dish is well priced, looks amazing - and elicits jealousy as I see plates for others being carried to others' tables. Last time I was there, we sat in for the long haul, ordered several bottles of wine and desserts - and in the end, we felt like we'd had a bargain. Love it and can't wait to return.

CSl4hOtsfRpxvm8XpgKdYQ.text: We tried to get into Mildred's a weeknight at around 7:30 but decided not to as the wait was rather long. I decided to back for lunch instead which was much easier. We got there at 12:45 and there was no wait, although the place did fill up closer to 1:15The menu looked very interesting and I had a hard time settling on what to order. A friend had recommended the starters (butternut squash pie and panfried halloumi), but as we were rushed for time I only had a main course. I had the borlotti bean and sunblushed tomato sausages, really good. My friend had the detox sallad with which she was also very happy.The service was average, but the food and venue makes the experience excellent.

ZpliBCer7Hfg3ovcnGwk0g.text: This is advertised as vegetarian restaurant but its just great food regardless of your dietary preference. Can't help feeling that its gone a bit more upmarket in the last couple of years and a bit more expensive than before. Its a popular place and can't help feeling that the staff are rushed off their feet hence the service doesn't feel 100% there, but its still good enough.The dishes I tried were in general very tasty (green curry, burger). Dessert was above par too.A great place to take your vegetarian friends and keeping them happy!

97enhao-zyQWYGDjIG_FPw.text: this is a great place for veg and non-veg eaters alike.  they serve accessible vegetarian food w/o too many meat substitutes, rather using whole ingredients to make the veg food appealing.on a thurs night, this place was hopping, and we had to wait for about 45 minutes at the bar.  i already had too much to drink before i got here, so i just had a beet, carrot, ginger juice to cleanse my palette.  the music in the bar was quite entertaining while we waited, too.  i felt like i was in a late 80s, early 90s r&b club w/ prince, dreamgirls, and tina turner playing in the background.we started w/ the artichoke crostini, gyoza, and fig and blue cheese salad.  i think my fave was the salad.  the gyoza tasted like something i could buy in the trader joes freezer asle.  for my entree, however, i had the burger of the day w/ a side of salad rather than fries.  delish and completely filling!  i could only imagine how stuffed i would be w/ fries.  one friend got the risotto cakes, and the other friend got the nut roast, which was the special of the day.  everything was yummy.  if i could eat like this everyday, i suppose i could be a vegetarian.by then, we were too stuffed to have dessert, altho the sticky toffee pudding would have probably hit the spot.

t7JbfhHaGOQ7CD9TMhAZPA.text: Vegetarian food that fills you up FTW!You guys, Mildred knows her stuff, and her busy little restaurant is worth the inevitable wait. Our party of 5 (awww scott wolf) had to be seated in the special upstairs room, usually reserved for private parties, and adorned with vintage (and may i say explicit?) porn on the walls.After sharing some delectable hummous and babaganoush for a starter, I tucked into the daily special -- an apple, fennel, and beetroot stew with "giant" couscous. I think the "giant" part sucked me in. Unfortunately, the stew was a bit heavy on the beetroot, and I was sorry I didn't order something that came with those delectable sweet potato fries. What is it about those tasty little fellas?Dessert: a fruit crumble (the fruit in it changes daily, mine was apple) sans cream that was absolutely scrumtrulescent. Piping hot apples beneath the sugary crumbly crumble. Yum. (Dessert has become a standard when dining out during Sober September for obvious reasons.)Everything else at the table looked immense and I heard nothing but "mmmmms" all around me.

9mabPGvrfDVfDmkYLPoK2w.text: As a vegetarian, I would definitely recommend this place. A great selection of food and great portions.It's not a posh restaurant considering the prices but definitely worth going at least once.

MPWv6-TegWig0xyK7DCoCA.text: Mildred's is affordable, as opposed to places like Saf in London. However, the atmosphere is at an all time L.O.U.D. and it's hard to enjoy the meal when you're screaming. Secondly, the line out the door would indicate that what's inside is extremely special. I had the starter and main of the day and left wondering why I put up with so much waiting and screaming. I suppose the food is fine, but - for my taste - not worth the wait.

hPCzZs4e7NB1FThS8OddlQ.text: Food is ok. Only tried one dish so I can't say too much about it. Seating is cramped. Waiters tend to clear of the table pretty fast after you are done (tool away my glass with still liquid in it)Overall 2 stars. I wasn't to impressed.

XQ50L1eDwzJWg59ADTrRzg.text: OK, so we had a bit of a wait to get a table, but the wait was kind of funny because while the waitstaff wait for their orders, they apparently take time out to whip their hair around in front of a fan.  No, for real.. I'm sure we just happened to be in on a cheeky shift so I can't promise any future performances.  The food is all vegetarian and while I am not, I do like a well-done vegetarian meal, they are easy to do wrong and turn out bland..  but Mildred's was very worth the wait.  Food was amazing, I had a pasta of the day: pesto with fennel and my friends had the burger of the day (bean, looked good), some other tofu things, etc.  I was told that the sweet potato fries were a MUST so we ordered a couple of bowls for starters, and they were indeed quite good.  We finished with an (apparently) soy cheesecake which I would have eaten more of but the portions for mains were so big that we were all well stuffed.  Well worth the trip!  I never really feel like I do enough dining out in that part of town so it's always nice to find little gem restaurants like this.

WXWB1G3k5WjwC0uZw-H5bw.text: Decent veggie place.I was not too impressed by the waiters, with impatient slightly snobbish attitudes. On top of which they automatically add 12.5% tip to your bill. I you can get past all that, the food is quite good. I am a fan of their appetizer dumplings. I can  go for a second round of those dumplings right now! The main course is average, but the nice decor makes this restaurant a decent place to visit.

ke-vnTRFIqiwPoM04EzUAQ.text: Staff- mixed, which I rarely mention first for a restaurant.  One was nice and the other was an a**.  The food was quite heavy for a veg restaurant, mine was nice but my wife's was dreadful, not at all what was described between the chalkboard (special) and the clueless, a** waiter we were stuck with.Also, this place is incredibly cramped (even for London) and very loud.

XE40CKml_EMlHYHsligpmg.text: Very good vegetarian/vegan place and also affordable. I had the halloumi burger and I share a gluten free brownie for just 20£

wVX0JcKtxRh2j0PfDwk-hg.text: Do not say: I will have the bean burger but instead of bean I would like cow.

oFy8DFo_bJnDSD8OxD7HCg.text: Caution: fickle veggie alert! From reading past Yelper reviews of Mildred's in Soho, I know this place is very popular so I feel naughty posting a not so nice review. As far as queuing goes, we waltzed right in and got a table immediately. Our waiter gave me the smug look of superiority as I dared to order a Diet Coke. No corporate companies here, all organic juices and freedom beer - fair play to them! With a bit of lunchtime rush I went for the soup of the day - Pumpkin and Carrot. It arrived in a brilliant dash of yellow flecked with parsley. Wow I was salivating already; this was quickly followed by disappointment. The distinct taste of the pumpkin was robbed by the overpowering flavour of chilli, making it quite spicy to my shy tastebuds. Never one for liking hot, spicy food I left most of it in the bowl. I can't understand why they would add this to the soup; no pumpkin/squash soup recipes I have ever seen incorporate chilli. But once I tasted the accompanying bread I sussed. The focaccia was soft, a touch salty and also chock full of spices, same for the rustic brown bread. After a couple of bites of everything, it felt like I had swallowed a spice rack. Vegetarian food is often accused of being bland, boring and tasteless. Mildred's seems to be ensuring that no-one dismiss its food this way by totally overcompensating on the spices. While I won't be running back there any time soon, I would like to try the burgers, burritos and salads I saw whizzing by.

IR1fRi0fC_Xk0WPFPBgRoQ.text: Delightful restaurant in the heart of Soho.  Great menu with rotatingspecials, excellent service staff.  The free wifi is a nice bonus.Always one of my favorites in London.  The restaurant can get a bitcrowded, cramped, and noisy, but hey, you're in Soho![Note: this place is fully vegetarian with several vegan offerings.]

px0aaDCX4LrbXQooouMh0w.text: The food is OK, the atmosphere is better. I had a pesto pasta which I enjoyed but it was swimming in oil. The menu needs more creative low-fat options to choose from. I actually thought the service was pretty friendly. Prices are a bit steep for what you get.

xSNh367shonkguxTN-1GBg.text: Whenever I'm in London, dinner at Mildred's is a must. For a San Francisco guy it's really nice to be able to go to an amazing vegetarian restaurant in London. The Brits have gone a long way to eliminate the stereotypes usually associated with English cooking, but to me, Mildred's is the reason I will never ever make fun of British food again.I dare say they actually out-do some of my favorite San Francisco vegetarian places.

WwIUjH8NG_B_NzFzlDFADQ.text: Yum yummy yum yum good for my tum tum.I went here with my sister a few months back and was really impressed. Both of us have been veggie since we were kids and our mum has spoilt us with great home cooked vegetarian dishes all our lives so it takes a lot to get us excited about veggie food. The place is quite small and does get busy quick so I'd book or go early. This is the only reason why the place hasn't got 5 stars. But saying that, if it was any bigger I think it would lose some of it's friendly and warm atmosphere.They have great sweet potato chips and the menu has a huge selection of tasty dishes. I thought is was well priced for what you were getting and overall it was a great meal out.Also, for you celeb spotters out there, Keria Knightly is often in here so keep a eye out in case she pinches a chip off your plate!

harZYNwGkUagKPRqlT-PdQ.text: Went to Mildred's Soho in between the Harry Potter shows so we got there about 5.30 on a Wednesday - so no wait.  It soon filled up and was buzzy and lively.  The service was all very friendly and slick.The food was just incredible - every course.  The crispy Seitan is probably the best veggie food I have tasted in a long while.  The wine was so good too.  Wish I could cook like that - how about some cookery courses Mildred's??Planning to go back very soon!

cruSNQVN5tSAm8RsuvkL0A.text: When in Rome, do as the Romans - Mildreds seems to be frequented by locals and visitors alike but I'm not sure it lives up to the hype.  We went on a Saturday and for a party of two, managed to only wait 36 minutes when we checked in shortly after 5.  The restaurant was insanely busy throughout the night, with the queue never quite abating.  Despite every employee seemingly going full tilt, service wasn't the most prompt.  The food was fine, but it was served lukewarm.  The mushroom pie's filling was not hot and that was just a real disappointment, especially since the kitchen wasn't slow in putting out the food after our orders were placed - that makes no sense.  Neither the pie nor the vegan bangers and mash were really stand out dishes.  I've had better vegan dishes elsewhere.  I probably wouldn't come again unless it was convenient and the wait was short.  I'd feel guilty about writing this review but I highly doubt my words will have any impact on their popularity.

photos.caption: Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom. Mushroom pie
Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom. Vegan bangers and mash
Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom. Brownie

A2rsAZ8Ns2ksZdtGRfYy4A.text: I went here for the first time about a month ago. Funny story though, my group and I had tried going to this location two years ago when we took a trip to London then, but the wait was over an hour and we didn't want to wait that long, so we went somewhere else. Now, flash forward to this year, we tried going here the first night of our trip, and the same thing happened again, and we left to go eat somewhere else. But then, we tried going the next night (the night this review is about) again a little earlier, and we didn't have to wait. So long story short: book ahead of time or get there before 6pm.LOCATION: This location is in Soho, and it's pretty near Oxford and Regent Streets, as well as Piccadilly Circus. It's a fairly nice area. 4/5ATMOSPHERE: The atmosphere is alright. We were sat in an upstairs area and it was kind of bland and stuffy, but the downstairs area looked a bit nicer. 3/5SELECTION: It's all vegetarian, and they label which items are vegan or can be made vegan. They serve a nice variety of different cuisines too. 3/5WHAT I GOT: I got the Soul Bowl, which includes carrot, beetroot, quinoa, cherry tomato, dates, parsley, mint, kale, avocado, shiitake mushrooms, cashew cheese (I got it on the side), mixed sprouts, seeds, and sesame dressing. It was okay, but nothing worthwhile. It didn't taste as fresh as it could and the flavors of the vegetables weren't that vibrant. I liked the variety of ingredients though. I would still go back and try something else though. 3/5SERVICE: The service was okay. The employees were nice, but it was just pretty standard service -- nothing stood out -- so that's why I just put an average rating. 3/5

photos.caption: Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom. Soul Bowl (12): carrot, beetroot, quinoa, tomato, dates, parsley, mint, kale, avo, mushrooms, cheese (on side), sprouts, seeds, & dressing

GIfi1WhNEjHoioCoNjMrqg.text: For starters we had:Salt and pepper tofuSpicy aubergineExcellent starters to get you wanting more.For mains we tried:Stir fried vegetables! This comes with rice too.And it was very tasty. You wouldn't tell it was vegan or vegetarian. It had rich flavours and the portions are very decent. For dessert:Apple and pear crumble with a creamy topping!!. That was a scrumptious meal and we couldn't afford to have any more. This is an extremely busy place. Only just realized that there are so many around who appreciate vegetarian food in London. There can be a good 15 to 20 minutes of waiting time, but the bar is always good to entertain you. They have a whole load of vegan/vegetarian drinks. So feel free to sip something while waiting to be seated. I would strongly recommend this place to anyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom

Ek0rCzKIcb6VJoe0LjpdCg.text: I visited this location for dinner with a friend and we went there early to avoid the crowds. We were served pretty fast and the menu was pretty clear about the vegan options (which are in the majority)My dish was the carribean jerk tofu which was delicious, and we also ordered a side of fries, which I really enjoyed as they were thick cut.We managed to find room for dessert and had the raw raspberry mousse cake (not to be missed) and the hibiscus wanna cotta which was also great.While we were there, we did not feel rushed to leave and the service was good. Not amazing, but it did the trick.

u2ow7kHPRaRGPS0jZdJsZQ.text: I used to really like Mildreds but I'm removing a few stars because I just really don't like their food anymore. I probably won't eat here again. The vegan options were boring and tasted equally as boring too. I had the soul bowl this time and wasn't impressed. The kale included in the dish was marinated in a sauce with odd flavor too, it was almost like they just dumped soy sauce on it. I also ordered the fries with the vegan basil mayo--seemed like they used the vegan mayo recipes from the early 2000's and not today, total waste of calories.All in all, not my favorite. Plus, the waiter was a snot to us the whole time. This is something that's happened to me before while dining at Mildreds. No thanks!

photos.caption: Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom. Vegan Soul Bowl

0ZosxTKWN6MlUWwCemrI5Q.text: Mildreds is a very popular restaurant and therefore me and my mother had to wait half an hour to be seated which was a bit annoying but the staff was friendly and apologetic about the wait.We were quickly being served and I ordered the fake chicken burger with fries. I must say that it was not to my liking, the burger, since there was too much vegan aioli and not much else as filling except a few sad leaves of lettuce. The burger reminded me too much of a McChicken from McDonalds, but of course if that's what you like, then you'll love it. The fries were really good though. My mum had an indian style type dish that she enjoyed.I am not sure we will choose this place again, the noise in there was incredibly loud as well, making it difficult to have a conversation.

photos.caption: Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom. "Chicken"-burger with vegan aioli and fries

djpCAWUf9NS10DyU6cGbgg.text: So, it took an hour queuing to get a table, so we sent one of the girls ahead to take on the task!!We went here for a friends birthday, two vegetarians the rest more than happy with veggie food and have had quite a bit before.Firstly the drinks menu is a bit random and limited, we requested drinks and they did take a bit of time to get the drinks to us.  Although the server herself was very smiley and happy to help.We ordered some starters, which were distinctly average.  The grilled Manouri cheese was okay, the guacamole was quite tasty to be fair, however really don't know what was going on with the hummus and bread, that really wasn't that great at all.We ordered more drinks and they came back a bit of a while later and two were wrong, but save messing about we said it was fine, leave it as is.The mains were really not worth waiting an hour in a queue for.  The burrito was bland and I've honestly done better at home when in a rush, just a heap of black beans and rice with little flavour and lacking fresh ingredients.The panko mock chicken was rather the disappointment, it was way over cooked and one of the girls had to make a concentrated effort to get her fork in!  Chocolate brownie and ice cream for pudding was nice.I by the end of the meal was sweating my bottom off as they sat me centimetres from the fire, and was left feeling a bit deflated that this was what we got.As an average place it would be fine, but the rave OMG reviews just didn't ring true at all with this place.  I won't be returning  at all as it's not worth the faff and shoulder sagging food you get served.

photos.caption: Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom

SCaNUR-wUKwoowdd7GX2Yw.text: Tiny, delicious, not overtly hipster veg spot.Whatever you get, just get a side of fries. You won't regret it. Nice ambiance and good sized portions.

O95Cer9UCp1w3gyqb5qCTw.text: Mildred's never disappoints. The only thing is having to queue for a table due to its ever increasing popularity. The food is fantastic, the menu varied and imaginative, and the people who work there are always friendly. All four branches are great, especially the original one in Soho and the one near Kings Cross.

dj04CbNKzvs28k-0t7oCag.text: The burger with chips and peas was the best!! And the meat pie was so realistic, I love this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom

3TxIxb6UZ7KsYet8Jp7irA.text: Good vegan food, but I've had better. Excellent cocktail selection. Little to no beer selection. The service is good. Noisy for dinner! Don't go if you want to have good conversation. Limited space and most tables are shared.

I_Q2qQKGMGvo5LIL8lm_vQ.text: Came here for dinner earlier this week, and while the food was good, the service was a bit weird. We stood around for a few minutes without being greeted once. Not by the bartender or anyone who was awkwardly staring at us, as we looked for a host. We were asked if we were okay with a communal table, as a 2 top wouldn't be available for 20-30 minutes. We said that was fine and sat down at an empty 4 top. I was facing the restaurant, and within 5 minutes of being seated, two 2 tops were vacated. Okay then. We were served promptly and the food was good, although days later, I cannot for the life of me remember what I ordered, besides the dumplings as an appetizer. We were headed to the theater after our meal, so when our plates were cleared and we were asked if we wanted dessert, I declined and asked for the check. Instead of the check, a different waiter brought dessert menus. Okayyyyy. Once he came back (he literally dropped them and then scooted away), I asked for the check again, paid and left. All in all, if randomness is your thing, you'd probably like this place. It was also super loud, as the restaurant itself is very small.

5wgTpmChpPRBght9NF82Eg.text: I have been stalking Mildreds and planning my order since we booked our flights ten months prior to our trip. My husband and I went to the UK to celebrate our 10 year anniversary, timing our stay so that our actual anniversary day was spent in London proper with an upscale dinner at Mildred's in Soho. The thing about Mildred's is that there is often a very long wait, as they don't take reservations, and there is hardly any room to stand and gawk at the outcoming dishes. I'm here to tell you, it was worth every waiting minute.We began our meal with the Grilled Artichoke Crostini, perfectly cooked artichoke hearts drizzled with lemon over chargrilled rustic bread. However, the star of the show was the labneh, a yogurt-based cheese that they have veganized. It was so creamy and fresh I nearly licked the plate! That and that alone would have been worth it!For our entree's, I choose a Katsu Curry Chick'n, served with forbidden rice and sensible green vegetables. My husband enjoyed the burger, along with a sizeable serving of sweet potato fries. While we waited, I was so excited and eager to be there that I chatted up the hostess after she kindly remarked on my sequined dress. Though Mildred's is upscale casual, that wasn't going to stop me from glamming up for our anniversary night! I told the hostess how much I had been looking forward to our dining there, and that it was our anniversary, and after we sat she brought us two glasses of bubbly as a bit of an anniversary gift! It was so very sweet of her! Mildred's absolutely lives up to the hype. They are worth every bit of the street cred they get from vegans and carnie's alike, and my only complaint is that they are not in Las Vegas where we live. It was a life-changing dining experience!

sT9rqEkVZ9VgrfqIGlW9lg.text: I really wish I can bring this place to New York.Although I am not vegan, I love vegan food - just to feel less guilty from consuming calories, haha, but this place was amazing. We straightly went to this restaurant right after we arrived in London; most of other places were closed too. Although it was quite late, the place was still crowded. I had japanese eggplant dish when my friend had mixed thai noodle. Both dishes were great. We saw other tables having desserts and wished we had room for them too. Next time, I am definitely getting their desserts!

N1F87UZq1xSkuc1ETGCLLw.text: I dined at Mildred's on a Saturday and it was seriously bustling. They don't take reservations and there is a good queue of people waiting when you arrive. We were told that we would have to wait 1.5 hours until we could be seated and that we would have to wait either by the bar or next door. We choose the bar which turned out to be a great decision as the cocktails were amazing! I highly recommend the bourbon splash and old fashioned something-or-another. They were also really reasonably priced (only £7.5 for a cocktail in central London). I guess the make up for it by always being busy and requiring patrons to wait by the bar.I really enjoyed the food too. I had some tofu and white bean sausage with mashed potatoes and other veg (basically a vegan bangers and mash). I really enjoyed it and the atmosphere was great. The only downside was the service, but even so, it wasn't thaaat bad (still 5 star worthy). The waiters didn't pour the wine or let us try it before hand (it wasn't a screw cap!) but luckily it was fine. We also had to wait a while for the bill etc. If they sort this out they'll really be a spectacular vegan restaurant.

CVn_FavwuyTkNnJJpjJXfQ.text: Saturday lunch you need to book. Packed out on all floors. We had booking. I was sceptical about a wholly vegetarian resturant but this is excellent. The menu is not huge which is a good sign. The food was top class in taste and presentation. Excellent wine selection too.

IiPShoF1lVJahMn2AuppaQ.text: Bring your appetite and patience because the food here is excellent with large portions and it's a bit of a wait for seating. We waited about 45 minutes for two seats and ended up sharing a table with another couple. We ended up ordering the following items:APPETIZER:Chargrilled roman style artichoke with crostini and lemon aioli - (4 star) £6.00. It was definitely not skimpy on the aioli. I would have liked more crostini.  Maybe if they allow ask for extra. Very flavorful. ENTREE:Sri Lanka Curry - (5 star) £12.00. MUST ORDER!! This dish contained flavored basmati rice, curry sauce, green beans, butternut squash with roasted peanuts. Doesn't that make your mouth water?!?! It was so good, I didn't want to share with the hubby. Packed with flavor. Mushroom and Ale Pie - (3 star) £12.00. This was my hubby's dish. I tried one bite of it and did not want another. Although this is a traditional English dish. It is one that I would pass. The flavor of the mushroom with sauce left a bad taste in my mouth. Since I'm not a fan of phyllo dough. It was a double fail. Don't get me wrong my husband liked the dish. It's an acquired taste. You'll either like it or not. DESSERTChocolate hazelnut brownie with salted caramel sauce and ice cream - (5 star) £6.00. MUST ORDER!!! This is truly a decadent treat, but worth the calories. Overall it was a great dining experience. I would have preferred to have our own table. The other negative item I would say is how close the table are to each other. I understand you want to get more seating, but seriously it's a little ridiculous. People if you need to squeeze between 2 tables please place your behind towards your table. I don't need your rear end all up on my food area!!! As for noise level. Not an intimate place. Especially when you can hear a guy telling his date that he is more than willing to sue his family in court and be loud and proud about it. This is more of a hang out, drink up and eat place.

photos.caption: Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom. Chocolate & hazelnut brownie with salted caramel sauce and ice cream (MUST ORDER)
Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom. Mushroom and Ale Pie (***)
Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom. Sri Lanka Bowl (MUST ORDER)

stTsAHdF76W4b9dKOs_tjw.text: Bustling Vegan Restaurant.  I am not Vegan but I tend to try Vegan/Vegetarian restaurants when the opportunity arises - We were traveling with our daughter who is currently Vegetarian.I had the Vietnamese Bowl.  Essentially a high fidelity Vegan rendition of a Vietnamese Beef Rice Noodle Bowl.  The "Beef" was flavoured  just like it would in a Vietnamese restaurant, great texture and flavor.  The Vegetables were very fresh and the Noodles were well done.My daughter had the Chicken Bowl.  I had a piece of the fried "Chicken" and the Almond Cream that accompanied the dish- it was good.  The "Chicken" did not get as close to the fidelity achieved on the "Beef" but it was satisfying.The Soul Bowl was on the sweet side - for a main course.  The Smoked Tofu burger was accompanied by Sweet Potato Fries that were cut a tad too big.Overall good Vegan meal experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom

ZQAbaTn3-GJp_CHt9E_g_w.text: Our first meal in London did not disappoint. I was ecstatic to see a vegetarian restaurant doing so well, there was approx an hour wait when we arrived that Sat night and it was packed all night. It's a great place to bring a date or hang with a group of friends. Although it can get very loud, which is to be expected. Even though it was busy, it felt like our meal wasn't rushed. The atmosphere at their Soho location was much more fun and pleasant than the other spot. Since it is a veg restaurant you need to be mindful of some of their dishes, since it contains eggs or dairy. I loved their beet burger and ceaser lettuce cups the most :)Oh and the chips, can't forget about that!

rhy8o0QdkYFww-LpfXQNgw.text: My cousin was in town visiting and since she's a vegetarian, I wanted to take her to a vegetarian restaurant. Mildred's had good reviews, so we decided to give it a go. I was worried we might have to wait a while since it was 7pm on Friday night, but they were able to seat us right away.We started with the artichoke crostini and spinach ravioli. My cousin and her friend seemed to enjoy the burrito and stir-friend asian vegetables that they got for their main courses, but I thought I was the winner with the risotto cake. The mint was a really nice and unusual touch. The highlight though had to be the desserts. We split the pavlova and the chocolate truffle cake. I think we pretty much licked out plates clean.

rBj2o3QoYz5nbrYyd5wM-g.text: Cramped and  not very tasty- the  burger was decent but this is basically a  pricey trendy soho restaurant with a  friendly host - bettter off at the SUBWAY

ilToP9Eh35mAh8Rp2VL7PQ.text: My party of three walked around Soho for a while, looking for places for dinner that would satisfy each of our tastes. It was close to 8 by the time we ended up at Mildred's, so we figured, might as well make a stop here.Our food was great - our table had a mix of the risotto cakes, the Ethiopian stew and the veggie burger of the day, plus a side of their sundried tomato cornbread. Can't say I was very impressed with the sweet potato chips - they weren't bad, of course... I just don't get the hype. Overall though everything was quite tasty.Agree with other Yelpers who say that the service isn't so good. Staff are very brusque, which makes them seem snobbish. And a single smile every once in a while would be nice. Also the place was packed (it is a tiny little space, after all) and REALLY loud (the key to making yourself heard is NOT to talk louder than everyone around you, folks - stop perpetuating the problem) but certainly cosy, I guess.Expect to climb over your neighbours, their food and their tables in order to reach yours. DON'T expect to have any sort of private chat, as your partner probably won't be able to hear a word you're saying unless you yell it across the table, thereby including your surrounding diners in the conversation by default.(Collateral damage or a blessing for the eavesdropper in all of us? Well, you'll just have to come to Mildred's and decide for yourself.)P.S. Mildred's offers free WiFi, but you need to have a password, which I think may be listed on a sign somewhere on a wall. Might want to investigate that one.

VD8yPtE1TpSbmerRycNBjQ.text: I don't know how Mildred's manages to make vegetarian/vegan food so tasty, but I absolutely adore their selection of fresh and meat-free dishes. The menu changes all the time to keep up with seasonal food trends. The wine is fantastic. My favorite dish was the butternut squash ravioli that I had one time. It's a teeny tiny place near Soho/Piccadilly and it's highly recommended!!!

Zg-XcZyQiOtTB-n4ukd83Q.text: What a wonderful, bustling and classy restaurant in the heart of Soho! When we arrived, the place was overflowing with people busily mowing down on fragrant foods but that didn't stop us from taking our spot in line and waiting our turn to have a seat. The wait was nowhere near as long as I had anticipated given how busy the restaurant was.It was Fall when I visited and I couldn't tear myself away from Mildred's seasonal specials board. I ordered the Pumpkin Coconut Curry Soup (see pics) and Pumpkin Ravioli with Sage & Brown Sugar Butter. My stomach is rumbling just remembering that meal - it was that good. Great portion size and speedy service considering how many people were there. Would return in an instant - I wish we had straight up 'cool'/non-weirdo veg restaurants like this in Toronto!

photos.caption: Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom. Pumpkin Ravioli w/ Sage & Brown Butter
Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom. Mildred's at night
Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom. Pumpkin Coconut Soup

iumbgT4SZrB_5N-y98LBMg.text: Mildreds is an institution among vegetarians, and food lovers alike. It's sat in the same spot in Soho for 17 years and is incredibly popular. When i used to think of specifically veggie restaurants I'd imagine skinny women picking at salads, or smug hippies feasting on beans. OK, well you do get some of that, but in the least offensive way. The downside to Mildred's is that you can't book a table and it gets VERY busy, but you can sit/perch in the bar area and wait for a table to become available. Once seated you are presented with an impressive menu, that gives vegetarian and vegan options, and a daily changing specials board. I always have the full three courses when i go, my recommendation being the warm beetroot salad (£5.25) to start, the sweet potato and tomato curry (£8.50) and for desert the profiteroles (£4.75) are the most amazing i have ever tasted. You can sip on a nice organic cider, or they have a vast selection of juices and smoothies. Prices are seriously reasonable, about £20 a head, as although you may leave full up to bursting point, you really feel like you've eaten good food and feel satisfied. They also offer a take away service that is incredibly popular at lunchtimes. Recommended for vegetarians and food lovers.

photos.caption: Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom

0pevdHeFDt9OOjv7oxyvsA.text: While I wasn't a fan of the building itself or the decor (this place was tiiiiny, yo), I really really enjoyed the food. I had one of their daily veggie burgers and sweet potato fries. I have an absolute undeniable 24/7 craving for sweet potato fries and THESE were amazing. The food was so filling, which was good because I was starving. So much so that when the waitress asked 'do you want to know what the vegetarian burger special is?' I said nope, just bring it out....THAT hungry. Mildred's did well, considering I'm usually a 'where's the meat' type of girl.I left, £10 lighter, feeling 5 lbs. heavier and vowing to come back and investigate some more of their food. Maybe not on a Saturday at lunchtime though, a little space would be great :)

aC4Ir9ABzIOrpGN622QriQ.text: I have been a couple of times and feel disappointed. I say this as everything I have eaten in there I know I could have made a lot better myself or know of other people that can cook it a lot better. Vegetarian food needn't be boring, I am not someone who has to eat meat at every sitting either but when I pay for food no matter what is in it I want good food. Mildred's is a place I feel was once somewhere wonderful but now is severely lacking on many levels when it comes to the food. I shared some homemade chips and basil mayo. They were ok, but not incredible. I followed this with a teriyaki vegetable and tofu stirfry which was rubbish. I had one singular leaf of pak choi amongst big chunks of onion, leek and broccoli all sat on some brown rice. There needs to be more chinese greeens in here and not just leeks in every mouthful. The tofu was so so, the sauce not punchy enough so the tofu just tasted like lightly soy flavored mush. My beloved had a detox salad with goats cheese which was pleasant but overpriced at 9.00. We decided to share a crumble and custard and I was severely disappointed in this. The custard was soy based but was thin and tasted like ricey dishwater. There was a distinct lack of vanilla. The crumble fruit tasted lovely but it was cold! By the time my meal was over I was enjoying the company of a friend as it was her birthday but inside I felt slightly sad that she hadn't experienced better food especially as it was a birthday meal and she doesn't eat out all the time. But I feel more irritated that a place like Mildred's had such rubbish choices on the menu and meals that could have been a lot better and didn't leave diners feeling they could have made something better themselves. My beloved was especially excited about Mildred's and has been raving about it and she too felt as disappointed with the food as I was. She has now resumed her growling about the fact I went to Viajante too. Seriously if I don't take her soon I am going to have a bitten off ear or will be forced to eat in Mildreds again. Yes the food really is that naff in there right now.

qpizN4qm6h5-NATSmIYW4Q.text: One of my London vacation highlights. I had my birthday dinner here and it is a lovely place. Great food, great atmosphere, awesome service and most importantly great food! I highly recommend stopping by if you're in the area. Delicious!

G5CWOB-3dqawIEhBfTAhHA.text: Great food. Crappy service. The hostess was very short and dismissive. I got turned away for a table because I only wanted to have dessert and was told repeatedly that once I have received the dessert, I have to leave the establishment. Zero tact. Uncomfortable experience.

gNWc8lzifOFGlXxTbPLxJg.text: Right just to get this clear i'm no veggie hippy, the closest i get is going to glast and sitting pissed in the stone circle.I thought oh what a nice place to go with a veggie having heard loads of good things about this place.  The fact that you can't book and it's always busy also i thought a good sign.so...was impressed with the menu, i didn't realise just how many things you could do with a carrot?I ordered the asian vegetable stirfry which was ok but really just consisted of spring onions and a bit of brocolli.  The fake sausages look alot better and i had slight food envy over them :(the service was pretty shit we had to wait ages for our meals and i felt a little scared by the waitress!  Clearly no time for niceness!Erm....take me to bodeans QUICK!!

LbHOcHonvZ1bHoyWGKRqtQ.text: This place is has an understated facade, which is a good thing, its like its trying to keep a good thing under wraps. So i felt even better for arriving. Straight over to the bar while waiting for friends. Its quite cramped at the front where the bar is but i think that added to the atmosphere. There are some lovely tables that look out of the window on to the street filled with pedestrians mainly, the scale of the street is quite intimate which gives it a specific sense of place.Pushing past the bar the space opens up to the restaurant which has a huge sky-light that makes it look ten time larger. You have to queue for a table but once youre seated just one look of the menu and you know youre in for a goodun. The service, highly attentive and pally type friendly in tune with the relaxed decor too. Food arrived in good time, well presented and clearly put together with great care.thinking back on the experience im changing this review from four as i write to five - there is simply nothing to complain of.

wDMFetK-ETJll7g-CAHstQ.text: Delish veggie/vegan food with generous portions. Everything we ate was so flavorful and savory, meat never crossed our minds. The staff were SUPER fun, attentive, and did a very cheery "happy birthday" song for my friend whose birthday we were celebrating. There is a wait even for weekdays so get there early!

HAfTUkAR_7TIHeVz_kyLuA.text: A real find! Lots of choice, generous portions and lovely food. The sweet potato and cashew curry is brilliant!The staff are friendly and attentive without being over the top.

XkoWd88XUnHUudTEWoFlzw.text: The food is fantastic.  Typically I'm very picky about veggie burgers but the aubergine and leek burger sounded too good to pass up and boy it was tasty! Too bad it isn't a permanent fixture on their menu.  My friends had the stir-fry and pumpkin filled ravioli and both said they really enjoyed their dinner.     My only gripe is the seriously lack of bar/ waiting space.  We waited about 15 minutes for table and we were constantly moving to avoid being in the way of other patrons and wait staff.  The service is fine, the price is right and the sweet potato fries are amazing!  Mildred's is a must for any vegetarian and meat eaters alike.

wLv4K77QRWHxadWmEtb59A.text: Absolutely amazing vegetarian food.  I have been searching for a place like this!  I personally hate all the fake meat dishes that seem to becoming so popular in vegetarian food. Mildred's focuses on bold flavors through its sauces and spices and doesn't feel the need to include the fake meat, because its vegetables and pastas can stand alone. DELICIOUS. I wish there were one in NYC or LA....

frYdpQZoR1r1LFRIOj7h1g.text: Was rather impressed with this place! Been hearing loads about it and went for the first time just last week. I had the tostada and ravioli to start and then we shared a veggie burger with top sweet potato fries. I also had a yummy soy/maple syrup shake which hit the spot!  Slight improvement points could be made for the burger (slightly bland) esp considering how pricey it is, but that's a small niggle. Happily would return x

TaFc-vMA61WA7Nmx1FAIUg.text: Great place with a fab (though loud) atmosphere. Thumbs up for serving real food, the tagine was flavoursome, the burger was great and filling, and the ale pie won over both my veggie boy and a meat loving friend. Only wish that I had had room for pudding!

rsKHGbjzwKits9u_mN7fnw.text: It's been said before but it's worth repeating...it's crowded and they pack you inif you're here for lunch past 1.10pm you won't get a tableit's all very worthy and non-corporate (perhaps a tad holier than thou)And yet I, the worshiper of being able to get a seat to eat my bacon sandwich at, am giving Mildreds 5 stars. because they do what they do well, becuase the staff although occasionally more laid back than me are never less than polite and because i could live on their sweet potato fries for the rest of my life.And becuase i have too many veggie friends to ignore the fact that mildreds prove that veggie food can be tasty inventive and bad for you.Yum

sD3MwU9i23BHn2xT07rcQg.text: Have you ever been stoked for a restaurant from all the hype but then realize that it is nowhere near your expectations? Mildreds is your "let-downer". I really want to like this place but it's way too crowded and somehow completely failing on the flavors. It's mediocre at best and the staff are quite in a hurry. Don't believe the hype!

2XNLaP35zt0WPoSRE5GK3w.text: Was here in December 2015. Burger was delicious, great juices. Small cosy place. Def will come back when im in london!

LWieMQqOLsd_uu5XbUkXGA.text: Last night I tried Mildreds for the first time after a couple of friends recommended it and It was pretty good. I brought a couple of omnivore friends with me and they were pretty impressed too. We had to wait for our table for a bit and ended up in a corner table that wasn't the most comfortable, but the food and the organic wine made up for it!We had the Thai tofu as a shared starter, and each one of us had the halloumi burger, the mushroom pie and the tagine: everything beautifully presented and yummy. The portions are pretty big, so we didn't have space for dessert! The only downside was that they took quite a long time to serve the food, but other than that, I would highly recommend this place!

-xwSGRbs5ZNgRK6aLqZihw.text: Mildred's is the perfect place to convince a meat eater that veggie and vegan food can satisfy.Speaking to the veggies: we all have those pesky carnivores in our life, right? The ones that say such annoying things as "A meal isn't complete without meat" or "If we didn't eat them, they would eat us". Take them to Mildred's and watch them quickly change their tune. With dishes such as bangers and mash, the food will feel familiar to even the most seasoned meat eater. The wonderful taste will do the rest of the job of winning them over.Speaking to the meat eaters: Y U no stop eating meat?Other bits and pieces: the restaurant can be extremely busy and you can have to wait for a table. They do not take bookings. Don't expect to have an intimate moment with a date. The table are about an inch apart.

90k_ZIFBHBktHhpd9T1w-g.text: Mildred's is one of those establishments my DH and I had been dying to cross off our list. After deciding to cancel our plans (due to weather, boo!) to go to the Southbank World Street Food Festival, we headed there in hopes we'd get a table.Eureka! There was no wait time and we were seated immediately. But boy...was it cramped! Mildred's is tiiiiiiiiiiiiny, catering to a lot of people at once. I didn't mind because there seemed to be no rush to get up and leave - enjoy your meal at peace, patrons of Mildreds. Have a few drinks and relax.We ordered our drinks. I had a Bellini and my husband had the Daas Blond beer. Our starters were the Mediterranean platter and the chinese fried dumplings. Let me say, it irks me when starters arrive before drinks. That's a basic - it shouldn't be done wrong. I'd like to quench my thirst after a day of shopping, thank you very much.Our starters arrived and I'd have to say, they were a mixed bag. Absolutely skip the Mediterranean platter, which our server said was marginally better than the Mexican platter. The yogurt and beetrot dip was the only savior of the mixture. Everything else seemed like it came off the shelf at Tesco express. Sorry Mildreds - I've seen better. The chinese fried dumplings, however, were FANTASTIC. Served with an amazing sauce and kimchi, we ate it down to the last crumb. If we could have had ten more of those, I'd have been in heaven. Please, please for the love of God, order these if you want to lose your ever-loving mind on a brief trip to flavour town...Mains were an easy choice. I ordered the tomato and basil risotto cake while my husband opted for the burrito (without the guacamole, please). Both came fast and the portions were MASSIVE. Everything was fabulous so I cannot complain there. We said we wouldn't bother with dessert but ordered the chocolate and peanut butter brownie, served warm with ice cream. Oh my. That was a treat. I know brownies are played out but I couldn't help myself, reader. I needed it. There is no better marriage of ingredients than chocolate and peanut butter and this union did it justice.I don't quite get what people are saying about the service being piss-poor. Our server was friendly, helpful and sharp. Our only complaints were the tiny sizes of the tables and the cramped seating. The bill was also a little ridiculous. Over 70 pounds for a few drinks, some starters and mains? Come on! Any restaurant with a burrito as a main course has no right to charge such astronomical prices, in my opinion. The menu changes every so often to go with the season so we will be back! Great meal.

aLk5-T-GNETMqzKAmIUoBw.text: My husband and I were underwhelmed by our meal here.  He ordered the mushroom ale pie served with french fries and mushy peas, and I had the sweet potato cashew curry with basmati rice.  We also ordered a Bellini cocktail each. I did not think my food was bad, but it was something I could have easily made at home, and the accompanying tomato sambal had no heat whatsoever and was too sweet to eat.  My husband's fries and peas were fine, but we both agreed his mushroom ale pie tasted odd.  Our drinks were disappointing.  I've had many well-made Bellini cocktails throughout my life, and this was not one of them.  The sparkling wine that they used was harsh - lots of bite to it.  And the peach puree seemed to be lacking entirely, although the beverage did have a slight muddiness to it, which suggests they did add something, I just could not taste it.  Service was pleasant enough, but given how busy it was, it was a bit hard to grab anyone's attention.  The space itself was cute, and I enjoyed the artwork displayed on the walls. If in the area, I might give Mildred's another go, but I'd be just as likely to try out another vegetarian place instead.

photos.caption: Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom. sweet potato cashew curry with basmati rice

lwLD6Fiv-JQnIZSm8hUsgg.text: So unbelievably delicious. Best of the best for veggie food in London. Drinks are good too and atmosphere is nice. It gets mad busy so prepare to wait, but it's worth it.

uP62ydhlVZ6nYMR-hYSoug.text: Surprisingly bad service. From forgotten drinks, to wrong entrees being served, to a double charge on beer, to servers who couldn't seem to care, dining at Mildred's was chaos. We asked for 3 small plates to share starters, the waiter gave us 2, saying 3 was a waste. In general, the waitstaff were stressed, forgetful, and rude. One even walked away when I tried to order ice cream. When we asked again, she said the kitchen was closed. Seriously? You can't scoop ice cream?!?! Our food was ok, I've been a vegetarian for nearly 20 years, and found their food lacking; it was ok, but not worth the 30 minute wait. My risotto cake, suggested by the waiter, was in this awful horseradish cream sauce. I love horseradish, but this was tangy in all the wrong ways.Nearing the end of our meal, we were practically forced out as they were closing so early. (Returned to edit this back in--looks like it was removed by Yelp) I'm not sure why my comment in this post was deleted, but, we were the only multi-ethnic table there at Mildred's and they were rude. Seating people in front of us, good served to us well after people who'd ordered after us. In general, I only felt welcome when I (white person) came in by myself. When my friends joined me, Mildred's turned off the charm.Don't waste your time and money with this place.

AHLZAFv328ssxWq3C7D6aQ.text: (For my 200th review, I was lucky to have a backlog of reviews to choose from, and am proud to recognize this excellent experience with a five star review!)Ah Mildred's. What a lovely place to have dinner, despite the bittersweet circumstances. It was former-London Yelp Elite (now San Francisco Yelp Elite) Eliza D's going-away dinner, and she chose Mildred's. A small group of friends, many of which were Yelpers, found ourselves cozied into this cheery restaurant to try our hands at the vegetarian thing.It ended up by complete coincidence that we all ordered something different. I wanted to try everyone's, but didn't, because I didn't want to have to share my burrito, which was hands down the best vegetarian burrito I've ever had, and one of the best Mexican meals I've had in the city. Prices are totally standard for London (I think we ended up splitting it out to £18 each, and we bought a bottle of wine in there), and quite good for the Soho/Picadilly area.I'd highly recommend calling for reservations, even for a small group. We were lucky enough to get in without one for an early Saturday night dinner, but I won't leave it to chance next time.

-uyAOw46l2iY7hlaJqptUQ.text: Upon entering the establishment I was pleasantly surprised with the natural light and cozy feel. There was enough seating to not feel too cramped and the menu looked great.I ordered the main course salad(there's only one) of which I have already forgotten the name of. Namely because it was terrible. For an extra 2 pounds they will give you four pieces of tofu - oh gee thanks! The salad consisted of 85% shredded carrot, 10% shredded beet, 2.5% nuts and seeds, 2.5% lettuce. Literally I could count the pieces of lettuce due to green not exactly blending in with all the orange. The dressing had a good taste albeit a bit too oily. I could not finish the meal having grown sick of carrot after the 20th bite. For a place rated this well I really expected more.Pick up your game Mildred's- a $16 salad needs to leave you completely satisfied- not disgruntled enough to leave a review. 3 stars because the other food items might actually be awesome.

hCKUs_eo5EYUj-PpHFVqWw.text: Excellent food! Satisfies vegetarians and meat eaters alike. I had a creamy mushroom pasta with sweet potato chips and they were both really yummy.

YpONuSgLsShQbxQa0b0mgg.text: Great restaurant! I am a meat eater but their veggie sausage was awesome! We were traveling with a baby and they were super accommodating. I will definitely be going back!

eIYt9hg7aDijYCiry4PD-Q.text: Lovely restaurant and staff. There was a long line when we arrived with a baby in a pram and the lovely hostess seated us immediately at a shared table in a lovely private dining room. The haloumi starter was incredible as were the tofu sausages and mushroom-and-ale pie and plum cheesecake. It was such a pleasant dining experience and the food (also the glazed beets with labneh!) was wonderful. Highly recommend!! The wait staff was just lovely and attentive and helped us carry the pram up and down. Excellent experience! Thank you.

xHmhsL8X5MCTfT2pTV4aSg.text: If you go to London, you have to try Mildred's! The food is wonderful, the place is lovely!

nOV2iwbsNhiR6Yxph8ix3w.text: So... as a veggie, you kinda feel obliged to LIKE vegetarian restaurants.  So I did try, I really did try.But, the service was grudging; the noise level was unpleasantly high; the food was barely passable (standard wholefood mush); and the price way exceeded that of a "normal" good restaurant in this area (e.g. Cafe Gourmand next door but two).I did my best ..

zMx0o4izNlyh3OzmMKh5-Q.text: I was really excited to try this place after reading so many great reviews.  Unfortunately, for me Mildreds gets high marks for style but less for the substance.There is a buzz about the place and it is stylish.  The food looks incredible.  But alas, the staff were brusque and snobbish and my partner and I both found that our divine looking food was bland.  Mine actually gave me tummy ache because it was too rich.  Deep fried, breadcrumbed risotto cake does not pair well with a heavy cream sauce.Mildred's falls into the category of places that I don't want to write off on the basis of one disappointing visit, and would try again; but I am in no hurry to because there are so many new places to be tried first.  Such a shame.

photos.caption: Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom

k88IhWxI__zWtkJw-ZGXHg.text: My favourite vegetarian restaurant in London. I've only been a couple times but it's so good. Tough to get in. The sweet potato fries and dip is delicious

X-C61DBv0z7ERomB-YFVMw.text: I took my wife here for lunch last Saturday, although I was late and by the time I had arrived, she had filled up on Starters.This is mainly becuase the portions here are a pretty decent size; I had the ravioli, and my wife a Tostada.The tostada was really good and so we ended up swapping plates, but the ravioli was also fantastic, with the sauce being the right combination of flavours.The veggie burger here was also really good, and kept me going for about 6 hours afterwards! (though the sweet potato fries may have had something to do with that).In conclusion I would definitely go again.

vEk2bzD3uum1sl2MGFRGQA.text: I think Mildred's may be my new favorite restaurant in London, and that's saying a lot. The building and atmosphere are lovely, with a very cozy feel. The food was incredible! We shared two dishes, the pumpkin ravioli and the basil risotto cakes. Both were delicious. Mildred's reminds me a lot of another vegetarian institution, Greens's, in San Francisco. I would recommend getting to Mildred's by 5:45 in order to be seated before the dinner rush. tldr: a London must.

g_FSOA3zFR4peaF20Lx8CQ.text: So, after reading raving reviews about this little veggie gem I finally made it a priority to go last night. And I was not disappointed. We arrived around 7pm to a packed room so we started off sitting outside indulging in cava (they were out of prosecco) and chatting. Really nice way to start off.After 30-40 minutes, we were seated. And I have to say, I just love looking at a menu and wanting to eat every single dish. It all sounded so delicious! Not being able to make up our minds, my friend and I decided for 3 starters (!) and two mains. All together we had the beetroot salad, the grilled halloumi and the dumplings for starters, while for mains we decided for the sweet potato curry and Asian stir fry.Everything was great - really good. I have wheat allergies and didn't taste the dumplings, but from what I understood they were divine. The beetroot salad was also quite good, however, the grilled halloumi was out of this world. Yum!I have to admit that we were so stuffed after starters, that we didn't really have the appetite to seriously dig into our mains. Such a shame as they were gorgeous. Another friend joined us later and had some chocolate cake with his cava - and told us it was just OK. We took his word for it, no room left for tasting.I would go back any day! :-D

ZtA2J3LXZn_3Q6Pw8E-gpw.text: Loved the food!! Even though the restaurant is slightly hidden it was good to come here and try the vegan plates!!! Have to rate the desserts as they were so yumm!! Already booked my table for my next trip ;)

GpvxN5CSstEDTzrXuP12xA.text: Love this place, the food is excellent and comforting. I've had the pumpkin tortelinni in a wild mushroom sauce, and the risotto cake which were both full of flavours.  The place itself is very nice, but tends to be noisy in the evenings.the lkunch quiches and salad are great for take away if you work in the area!

2iT9ArLZXXTg_vIiVF91-w.text: Cocktails were really good especially the drink called southside. The wait was long but the wait wasn't bad at all since the bar was open to people waiting. Food was really fresh and all the vegetarian options were amazing.

rsdtwSXOOnUHQlD5u0WHPw.text: Veggie paradise! At the tail end of a VERY long week, no groceries, a veggie pal in town...we needed a late lunch (ooops, we didn't even wake up until noon!) for shopping sustenance. We were greeted warmly, ushered in from the never-ending rain (seriously, they are not lying about the rain over here), situated at a two-top near the quaint back area and equipped with water...and a bloody mary for me. It went down like a champ. I figured it was like a smoothie that might take the edge off. It was! I had the middle eastern meze with beetroot yoghurt dip, chilli feta dip, tabouleh, pepper stuffed baby aubergine, rice and mint filled vine leaf and flat bread. It was absolutely incredible. Super fresh, so filling, bright, beautiful veggies. Service got a bit hit or miss as the meal wore on, but nothing to worry over. Just took a lot longer than we had anticipated, but they did get very busy. They are in a prime location. London isn't the easiest place to be a vegan/veggie, eh? Have no fear, make a stop over to Mildreds. I'm dreaming of the beetroot yoghurt dip as I type this. OMG. Get it.

vWEGXOYx0AUDb_jqSZamXg.text: Vegetarian or non vegetarian...you will love this place. They offer vast selection of dishes that will make everyone happy. And vast majority of them is glutten free.

qTl5kz1oiSx1geqyyMhF5A.text: Real good food, low prices, friendly staff, vegan options and clean bathrooms. It was packed the day we went so service was a little slow but we didn't mind, the food made up for it , specially the dessert!!! . My friend was feeling under the weather so they made her a fresh orange smoothie with ginger, definitely helped her.   Don't skip dessert!!! Or the mocktails!!!

YLY48ok1a7Q8vPajAvcxTw.text: What an interesting experience... The place is very quant, love the atmosphere but we had to share the table which was a bit weird plus it was s girls night soooooo... Some topics of convo were not family friendly Anyway, for the food-it was nice, interesting menu but didn't blow me away. I really wanted to have loved it. Sorry

DHAFzSdAgcyeQRJj8ELDsg.text: Absolutely amazing food & service! Such a variety on the menu, great atmosphere!

ypBldOML8Wz7rD17ibGlKA.text: Looking for a nice dinner spot before a Play & Mildred's fit the bill perfectly. Luckily I needed an early dinner to make my show so I got there right before the huge dinner rush - the place was slammed by the time I left Drinky included the best elderflower sparklie drink that was so incredibly yummy - add a bit of vodka & we're talking YUM! I had read a lot of great things about their veggie burger but when I asked the server what she thought was better, she couldn't answer....so I went w/ a more traditional / only-in-London kind of dish instead Mushroom & Ale Pie w/ Chips & Mushy Peas - there was a strong rosemary undertone (or some other herb I can't really say) that gave this an interesting flavor, mixed w/ the Ale. The "pie" part was a nice phyllo-esque. Chips were somewhat dry but mixed nicely w/ the peas & "gravy" from the pie I was advised before ordering that I'd better like mushrooms b/c this had a lot & let's just say this thing was a *fungal overload* ( in a very good way! ) Huge variety of different mushrooms that added so much flavor complexity due to each soaking up the herbs & gravy in such a different way - amazing Sticky Toffee Pudding for dessert was super-delish! Nice & caramely w/ a strong toffee flavor - adding ice cream (or rice cream) would have put this over the top but was still a decadent treat indeed! Lots of other yummy sounding dishes to try & I'll def be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Mildreds - London, United Kingdom. Mushroom & Ale Pie w/ Chips & Mushy Peas

-LMALmbeB6aofZqdmh6bEw.text: Good food, a little noisy, good service. Nothing special but nothing bad.

u9OajvBazpNy_yMnOxbduQ.text: I had really high hopes for Mildreds because everyone raves about how good the place is. Unfortunately, that was not my experience. I order the classic burger and brownie. The burger is okay, the best but not the worst, but the brownie was delicious. I'd come back just for the brownie. I am giving it four stars because of the brownie and awesome staff/ customer service at the place.

eal5DFuxmKNH2VfLnv1arQ.text: Some of the best and most tasteful vegetarian food I have had, but the place is crowded, noisy and people are cramped together. We had to wait quite a bit for our table, but had a (free) drink in the bar while waiting. Great food, did I mention that?

Mr8BDPHW2apDPROYC6X65Q.text: This restaurant is by far the very best veggie/vegan food I've tasted in London! The queue outside is a good indicator of what goes on inside! The staff are always nice and super knowledgeable about the food and drinks available. There are always daily specials and your favourites. The starter I always have is the chargrilled artichoke, I'm salivating just thinking about it! My choice of main dish varies as I like to try new things. My only thumbs down for this place is that they changed their chocolate bombe dessert which was an insanely decadent indulgent 4x chocolate feast of the tastebuds by replacing one of the chocolates with a raspberry coulis. I haven't been able to enjoy any chocolate / rasperry combination since.. But that's me, everyone else seems to really enjoy the raspberry dessert. And it's still by far my all time favourite restaurant in London. So you should visit. Today. And tomorrow. And so on.

KVTQ76Je8jaxJi3Nmp--1Q.text: I love meat, and being Chinese, I eat a lot of meat. But sometimes, a girl misses veggies and clean eating. I had always seen a horde of people waiting at Mildred's, and couldn't understand why anyone would wait so long for vegetarian food.LET ME TELL YOU.  I now know why.  The sweet potato fries with its salty, crispy exterior.  And the detox salad with freshly grated beets and carrots.  And the grilled halloumi with its slightly sweet sauce.  And the Mediterranean platter with beautifully tangy beetroot dip and feta dip.  Everything tasted like real, non-processed food and made us appreciate each flavor and combination.  Even my friend wondered if the carrots tasted more ethereal here.I don't know, but I'll give up meat if vegetarian food tasted like this all the time.

AmyylXFmv3HhfLbzkEwEyg.text: Wonderful veggie place.We hired the upstairs room for a party and even the non vegetarians loved it!Have tried most of the dishes and they are always deliciousIt does get very busy, but for good reason!

HtEYWzGzcSE9G8jfGQayFA.text: So lovely to go to a restaurant with an all-vegetarian menu!There's no booking policy, so you have to wait for your table at the bar, however the food makes up for this inconvenience. I had the truffle tortellini, which was life-unchangingly good.  My friend had the veggie burger which was also delicious. Definitely worth a visit for vegetarians and non-vegetarians alike.

aawSkkhFFvhHG1aQOIB5Aw.text: The place was packed when we arrived, but three different staff members assured us we would be seated as soon as possible.  After a ten minute wait, we were indeed seated.  The atmosphere is very casual and the staff is very friendly.  All the dishes we had were delicious, but the risotto dish and the sausage dish really stand out.  Sadly, they were out of the chocolate peanut butter brownie, but the puddings we ordered were all top notch.  The crumble of the day was especially good.All in all, a very good late dinner!

qz0C3H5WwkXQ9tlxEaJ1Aw.text: Mildred Pierce This Ain't Baby ! Tucked away discreetly on Lexington Street, I've walked past this restaurant several times, without ever being troubled with the urge to visit it.  But for it being the birthday pick of my BFF Charlie I honestly, would have kept on walking. When I mentioned to my Pop that I was going to a vegetarian restaurant for a friend's birthday, he smiled and reminded me that if there wasn't any meat on my plate for dinner when I was a kid, I would get down from the table and go off and sulk somewhere.I smiled when he said it, but only realised the significance of his story, when I ran my eyes down Mildreds menu. I plumbed for the stir fried Asian vegetables cooked in sesame oil and plum sauce with garlic and ginger. Favoursome yes...but....not enough to make me forget how I much I love meat. For me vegetables represent side dishes to enhance the main event and if I'm brutally honest, vegetarian cooking has to be pretty darned amazing to thrill a die- hard carnivore like myself. If you're a veggie, I'm sure this place will be right up your alley, but for me it was a valiant effort to convince my taste buds, that vegetables as a main meal can rock. Unfortunately, it failed for me. Add to that bland interiors - a pop of warm colour would have raised the tone so easily. The queue - we went on a Friday night and waited so long, so close to the front door, that popped open so often, I didn't manage to get warm during the whole duration of our stay. Even when we were eventually seated at the back of the restaurant. Will I be going back, sorry to say not anytime soon.

eEKO1kyWCJ6PlB6pYEjjiw.text: After finally trying out Mildred's for a dinner with family and friends I understand why it is so popular!The service is great and attentive, in spite of being always very busy, their organic Spanish red wine is delicious and the choice of dishes, all vegetarian, is excellent.The quality of the dishes is very good, I would definitely recommend it and go back to try out something new each time...No booking required, just show up and wait to be seated, but expect a good half an hour waiting time in the evening after 8:00pm, any day of the week.It's a Paradise for vegetarians!

umFm4glkromJmTql8yh-Sw.text: Never have I been so excited to eat salad! Everythign they serve up is perfection and even got my vegetable hating boyfriend to eat some.The staff are so lovely and make you feel at home and welcome without being overbearing.I cannot get enough of this place!
